helpful_reviews.title: Overall good sports app
helpful_reviews.author: yannki18316
helpful_reviews.content: Overall good sports app, which however needs some major important functions added:  (i) There is no way to see your current pace on the Apple Watch 3 App when running. Only split (for 1km) and average for the whole workout can be seen. This is especially a problem when you do interval workouts like yasso800Â´s, since you donâ€™t know the speed for the 800m you are running. Other apps can easily do it and I donâ€™t get the point why Strava just doesnÂ´t add a third option of current pace besides split and avg.  (ii) There is no way to use your Apple Watch 3 to record a swimming workout and upload it to Strava. The only thing you can do is upload a workout manually, but it wonâ€™t show you the splits not anything. The Apple Watch 3 is the most native device to iPhones and the activity app nicely records the swim data, so it there should either be an option to import that to Strava or do natively record a workout with the watch in Strava.  (iii) it would be nice if there were certain standard interval workouts added, so you can choose the pace you want to run and the distance for each split and the watch will tell you when to speed up/ slow down.  Hope to see some of these features added in the future! Keep up the good work!

helpful_reviews.title: Strava/ tandem
helpful_reviews.author: fsirplay
helpful_reviews.content: I spend more time on Strava than Facebook for example. I love how we riders, runners, etc, stay connected by our love for the outdoors. I love to give kudos of encouragement to all of my friends and peeps new to a sport!  It is so satisfying to get a PR, or end up on a leaderboard, the motivation is tremendous. Itâ€™s encouraging to see young women emerge as cyclists, truly great for women to be in this sport. Itâ€™s a growing trend!! Yeah! I have one peeve.... my cyclist women, and male  friends and I are frustrated by the fact that women on tandems with their strong male athlete husbands pulling them along to QOMs or top ten places on the leaderboard are distorting the stats.  We are tired of flagging both their rides for unsportsmanlike conduct.  Please fix this! Create a tandem category. You did it for E bikes.  It will resolve the problem!! :)

helpful_reviews.title: Great App! Fun and Serious ! Motivates!
helpful_reviews.author: News man with eyes
helpful_reviews.content: This is the Depository of all workout apps. If you use Garmin or Apple- itâ€™s a must have. You will see your friends workouts and be able to compare your workout to theirs...Seamlessly!   Segments are so easy. Compare your times to other who have done the same route or a small portion of a route: Run or Bike. For example: I might have just bike 50 Miles. There might be 10 segments and I can choose any or all when I am done. Strava letâ€™s me see how I did against: other males; females; how I ranked today- for the year- all time- and if youâ€™re Premium then by weight and more!  Set up your own segment and watch how you rank. This is fun and motivating for me. Also- I love how it keeps track of my mileage YTD and I can see how many miles I road at a quick glance.  I love my Garmin Connect, but this lets me see my buddies and I can find and or follow all my friends and track how hard they work out by their HR score (Suffer Score?).  This is a must have app. Set your privacy setting to what your comfort level is if you just want to share with certain people.    Learn, analyze and enjoy each workout with the App that gives back!

helpful_reviews.title: Pretty good. But missing some nice things
helpful_reviews.author: James Sumners
helpful_reviews.content: I have been using Strava directly over the past few weeks because Wahoo Fitness developed a bug that caused it to constantly drain my battery even when completely closed and background permissions revoked. Strava retains the accuracy I was accustomed to with WF, and its auto-pausing and auto-resuming is far better. However, there are a few things I really miss from WF that I wish Strava had: prompts every 5 minutes with an audio summary of chosen stats; current speed display in addition to overall average; current BPM display in addition to overall average; sharing to other services (I like to export to RunKeeper for historical reasons).   The lack of these features isn't enough to leave a 3 star review but they're enough to remove the fifth.

helpful_reviews.title: Works Pretty Well
helpful_reviews.author: The Dude S
helpful_reviews.content: I like the app to keep track of the miles I ride.  I would suggest one serious improvement, one wishful modification, and have had one user issue.  The serious improvement Iâ€™d like to see, is a more sensitive auto-pause mode.  I see many race-oriented cyclists running through stop signs.  I think Strava is contributing to this.  If the pause feature worked better, cyclists could stop at stop signs and be penalized less.  The issue I have is that my rides do not get saved frequently.  I have an iphone 8+ with the latest software update.  Sometimes I check my ride stats at the first stop, and there are none.  Sometimes I try to end and save a ride, and an older ride I did pops up instead.  Sometimes it looks like itâ€™s saving a ride for me, but the upload simply fails.  This always happens when I get home, and have an excellent internet connection.  The wishful improvement Iâ€™d like to see is auto-record.  I used to use â€œMovesâ€� before i started using Strava.  With that app, it records your rides the minute you leave the house.  You donâ€™t have to launch the app and start it.  I often forget to start Strava, which results in me losing many miles.  Thanks!

helpful_reviews.title: With latest release Strava stats and charts are still wrong
helpful_reviews.author: abeginner
helpful_reviews.content: For swim analysis the fast split pace is slower than average pace, which is mathematically impossible.  Also the swim pace chart looks like 90% of the data is thrown away; the resulting chart looks marginally better than random, especially if you have a mix of intervals and long swim sets.  The stroke rate is called cadence, and I canâ€™t tell if it counts â€œone cycleâ€� as both arms or one arm.  Pool length says 25 but not yards or meters, and I swim in both 25yd and 25m pools so the most important info is missing.   The running pace chart shows an abnormally high amount of pace variation for a steady run (compared to my Garmin chart, and both are created from the same raw data.)   At least the pace charts have meaningful labels on the axes.  Before the running pace chart would only label the 6:00/mi and 12:00/mi tick marks, but now it has every minute pace marked.

helpful_reviews.title: Apple Watch app
helpful_reviews.author: CaroC2002
helpful_reviews.content: The app for the Apple Watch has many problems. (1) if you start a run and immediately want to stop it, you cannot. The app must detect significant motion motion which makes it not worth using. (2) I uninstalled the app and reinstalled it to deal with the previous issue. My watch told me that i need to login to my account on my phone for it to work, but when I went on my phone app I was logged in and it said my watch was set up. (3) it often does not account for parts of my runs and gets the time - and therefore pace - super inaccurate. For example, I will run 2.5 at about 7 min pace in reality and it will record that I actually ran 4 min avg pace and my first mile took a minute which which is obviously just wrong.   I really would like to use this platform but the watch app is just so disfunctional that I would not recommend it and will switch myself if these problems are not dealt with soon.

helpful_reviews.title: Decent
helpful_reviews.author: DirtBagDoc
helpful_reviews.content: Nice app interface for basic functions. The social aspect isnâ€™t too intrusive which is nice. Itâ€™s fun being able to compare times on different run segments. Thereâ€™s some data in the pro version that isnâ€™t accessible on the app which makes the pro version less desirable. Garmin uploads seamlessly which is nice. Some of the King of the Hill top times could be weeded out as there are impossible times (ie 1/4 mile run uphill has a king of the hill at <30 seconds). I understand why some of the pro features are paid (data analysis, Training plans, etc) but there are a few really basic features that are only for the pro version that should be accessible in the free version like setting a mileage goal for the week. Overall average app that Iâ€™d like to see improve because I use it all the time!

helpful_reviews.title: Basic Features Broken
helpful_reviews.author: Veraxus
helpful_reviews.content: Strava has two very important premium features: Beacon, which lets loved ones or crew follow your ride in real time for safety; and Heart Rate monitoring via Apple Watch. Unfortunately, do to very poor programming, you canâ€™t use both at the same time. To track heart rate you have to start the ride from your Watch - but to use Beacon, you have to start the ride from your phone. Neither phone nor Watch communicate with each other in real time, so you canâ€™t use both - just one or the other.  I really canâ€™t comprehend how a major faux-pas like this happens, and worse, Strava has known about it for almost two years now and hasnâ€™t lifted a finger to fix it. Given the poor state of the app, I recommend using Cyclemeter instead. Unlike Strava, it WILL track both your heart rate and live broadcast your location at the same time. You know, the absolutely basic things youâ€™d expect a $7/month app to do.

helpful_reviews.title: Active Sync with Apple Watch?
helpful_reviews.author: Mr Reptar
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve been using Strava to log my runs and rides. I enjoy the accuracy and features this app provides. One thing that I miss from using the Nike Run app is that if you open it from the phone and your Apple Watch is connected, it will show you the data on your Apple Watch and use it as a heart rate monitor. For strava, if I start it up on my iPhone, it wonâ€™t show the live data on the Apple Watch or use the Apple Watchâ€™s sensor. A little disappointed that it does not allow that. I have to constantly start the app from the Watch, but then that doesnâ€™t allow me to send my beacon alerts. Would love for this feature to be added; having both units in sync, especially when initiated from the phone.

helpful_reviews.title: Have used Strava for many years.
helpful_reviews.author: mr. m m
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve been using Strava religiously for years and love it!  Thus, 4 stars.  As soon as they remedy the below item, Iâ€™ll change this review and give them 5. I donâ€™t really get while theyâ€™ve included manual activities like Kite surfing, Rock climbing, and Yoga - and with each update, they continually leave out any type of combat sport. As popular as the multitude of combat sports are these days, it seems like a conscious effort to exclude them. And Yoga?  What possible metrics would you need to measure for yoga? That said, my complaint is a minor and very specific complaint. So itâ€™s not a big deal.  I still use Strava 5-7 xâ€™s week for cycling, running, hiking, snowboarding, snowshoeing, and/or workouts.  And itâ€™s been very reliable. ** premium user.

helpful_reviews.title: Poor user interface while running
helpful_reviews.author: gatorjos
helpful_reviews.content: I want to love this app and I do like the community aspect of Strava, however the UI while running had gotten me so frustrated I'm staying to look around.   I don't own a smartwatch so my interface is the phone in an armband strap. That means I'm pushing the touchscreen through a plastic shield admittedly less than ideal.   Couple of things: 1. I keep accidentally going into the map mode while I'm running. I don't need map mode I know where I'm going. It took me forever to understand how to get back to the big numbers that show your pace etc. That's really hard to find.  2. Auto pause works like crap. It autopauses when I'm walking up a steep hill or does not pause when I'm taking a break and actually stopped.  I think the running mode should only have giant buttons. Having a little "hide" button on the top right of your screen when you are running and trying to manipulate the app through an armband is useless. The all could also use better smarts around track record. Like when it auto-pauses when I am still running and then didn't figure that out post factum to backfill the data.   Anyway I have lots more, but just know this app feels like a cycling app that was also turned into a running app

helpful_reviews.title: Meh
helpful_reviews.author: jrodrocks510
helpful_reviews.content: This app works just as well as other GPS apps, but thereâ€™s still much to be desired. First, it only reports distance to the tenth of a mile instead of hundredth. Second, it does not give you the option of choosing to hearing your average pace after every mile, but instead only tells you the total time and the time of the previous mile. Third, every time I start a run it will start, pause, then restart. Finally, you canâ€™t preset how far you want to run, so if youâ€™re running an out an back for an odd number of miles you need to stare at your phone/watch until it says 2.5 (if youâ€™re running 5 miles for example). This issue is exacerbated by the first problem I mentioned. If my training program wasnâ€™t linked to Strava I certainly wouldnâ€™t be using it.

helpful_reviews.title: Why Background App Refresh?
helpful_reviews.author: FlyingEar
helpful_reviews.content: My old tracker app was not going to be supported by iOS 11 and a friend recommended Strava. I really like the app and appreciate that it does everything I need despite the focus on social networking which isn't my cup of tea.  The one thing that really bugs me is Strava's requirement for Background App Refresh to be active. I never needed to have that on for my previous tracker and I don't even need it for most apps which handle GPS and data functions just like Strava. I usually leave that function off to preserve battery life so it is an extra step (along with turning on location services) I have to take when starting Strava. If it could be updated to eliminate that requirement, I would give this app 4.5 stars (I know I have to pick an integer).

helpful_reviews.title: Needs a lot of work
helpful_reviews.author: qplunk
helpful_reviews.content: I like the organization of the app, the interaction with friends, and how Strava shows your progress on routes you run often. I do not like how the pace that is posted is different than my actual pace, even with the auto pause turned off. If I have to stop because there is a red light on my route, I want that to stay calculated in my overall pace. I donâ€™t want to think I run an 8 minute mile if Iâ€™m only running a 9 minute mile.  Iâ€™m also extremely annoyed with the GPS on this app. There have been multiple occasions where I run a quarter mile or more and strava just doesnâ€™t pick it up. I donâ€™t want to be cheated of mileage or need to stop during a run to restart my phone and app so that the rest of my run and pace isnâ€™t effected by strava. Iâ€™ve heard great things about run keeper and will be switching over.

helpful_reviews.title: Needs Improvement
helpful_reviews.author: ZurichGuy
helpful_reviews.content: This is my second season using Strava for road cycling. This year, it sometimes â€œlooses meâ€� near the end of a ride and then when I finish, it just draws a line from where it lost me to where I stopped.  I use a C-dale cycle computer that Iâ€™ve calibrated to exact distances. Strava under and over reports the distances of my rides, sometimes by as much as 0.5 miles per 12 mile rides. Also, Strava consistently over reports max speed. Cycle computer reported 30.1, 30.3, and 29.1 and Stravaâ€™s numbers were 48.1, 45.0, and 36.9 for the same rides.   But the worst is calories burned. I used four different methods to track calories (HRM, cycle computer, fitness tracker set to cycling, and calculated from ride data).  Those four vary slightly from ride to ride but generally give similar numbers for calories burned. But the Strava numbers are always about half of those other four methods (with a low of 41% lower and a high of 60.5% lower).  I contacted Strava and provided complete details. Their response was basically â€œwe like our methodâ€�.   The only reason I keep using it is because it tracks my efforts on various segments of rides and lets me know when Iâ€™ve improved on segments. I just wish the rest of the app was more accurate.

helpful_reviews.title: Logging Data to Health app
helpful_reviews.author: Fort Mudge
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve used Strava for four years to track biking and walking miles and Iâ€™ve been generally thrilled. Itâ€™s accurate (checked against odometer and Google Earth) and convenient and does everything I really need. But the link to the Health app needs fixing. When I edit an event (add a description, fix a typo leaving the data strictly alone)  Strava adds a new record to Health rather than updating the existing record. So the particular event is duplicated and my total mileage, calorie and other data appears to double as tabulated in Health. This should be an easy fixâ€”just delete the old record before adding the revised record.

helpful_reviews.title: Best running app, but...
helpful_reviews.author: Zeroes
helpful_reviews.content: Strava is the best app for analyzing run data, segments, progression over time, etc. As a data nerd, I love it, and happily pay for the premium service.   But, the Apple Watch app is an embarrassment. There are dozens of threads about issues people have with data syncing, lost distance, unclear online directions, worse data collection than Appleâ€™s built-in tools (which Stavaâ€™s team have access to through APIs). I use Appleâ€™s Workout app to track my runs, and import to Strava with a third app (RunGap). This is the only way I have been able to consistently track my entire run, get heart rate data, and have a watch app UI that is well thought out. The data I get though this process is as robust as the best dedicated GPS watches, but I canâ€™t get it done with Stravaâ€™s app.

helpful_reviews.title: Was a Great App until a recent format change
helpful_reviews.author: Crackie999
helpful_reviews.content: Stava used to be a great app that I used all the time i'm often multiple times a day, and really found it helpful and a great way to track my friends. Unfortunately there was a recent update to the format and now it is not very useful. I keep seeing the same bicycle rides in my feed. Just because a group of people I follow went on a big group ride, it just keeps coming up as the group ride to re-re-re-review over and over and over. The Strava feed worked better when it was in chronological order. It would be great for users to be able to select the classic view if that is what they want. I don't use Facebook so maybe that's why I don't understand this new feed.  It may be time to start using one of the other apps instead of Strava.

helpful_reviews.title: I main Strava these days
helpful_reviews.author: SunSparc
helpful_reviews.content: I have used and enjoyed other activity tracking apps. I, like many others, was introduced to Strava by a friend. I enjoy the social aspects, being encouraged by friends and in turn encouraging them. I enjoy having challenges to work toward. I love seeing how my runs compare to previous runs. I am glad that the developers keep trying to make the app better.  I tried premium but my training style is more casual so there was not as much value in it for me. A tiered subscription might be enticing for users who are not trying to be professional athletes. Plus my friends can already track me with other apps.

helpful_reviews.title: App is not good
helpful_reviews.author: RandomUser1111119999
helpful_reviews.content: Stravabooks app isnâ€™t good at all. Rather than hiring good developers they hired marketing people to repackage old features into â€œSummitâ€�. The Apple Watch app is straight trash. The metrics used are not useful and it isnâ€™t customizable. Do us all a favor and download ismoothrun and copy it. Seriously. Also, syncing... 3rd party apps sync with strava faster than stravas own Apple Watch app!! In summary, fire the marketing dept. hire some new and good devs (not from boot camps please) and get to coding a good app like iSmoothRun.  The 3rd party app integration is a joke. For example, MINDBODY. It doesnâ€™t always sync and when it does all I get is a picture and some lame title. â€œJoe did yoga @ the gym w/â€œ. That isnâ€™t useful at all. What would be useful is having 3rd party apps able to upload stats from the actual workout. Oh wait I use HealthFit as a janky hack to do just that.

helpful_reviews.title: Great Social Activity app with some features needing improvement
helpful_reviews.author: evancycles
helpful_reviews.content: Great way to connect with friends, compare segment performance, and download routes. However I feel other apps do some non-social things better. For example: The app Ride with GPS creating routes feature is a fine tuned machine compared to Stravaâ€™s clunky beta route builder, even my Lezyne GPS comes with a better route builder online app.  The ability to upload a GPX file not related to a Strava activity into the Strava route builder would be helpful.  Overall Strava has become the Facebook of Running, Cycling and swimming with some good features, but itâ€™s currently not the one and only app I use at the moment. I go back and forth on if the premium membership is with the cost, but Iâ€™ll likely renew.

helpful_reviews.title: New Start feature on mobile is TERRIBLE
helpful_reviews.author: annoyed by strava
helpful_reviews.content: I have been using Strava for a long time - 4 years or so. As of the last update, they added a feature that when you start an activity a window pops up that makes you select an activity, then you have to hit Start again to start the activity. This is SO ANNOYING. Why do I have to click 3 buttons to do one thing? Please revert back to the old way of starting an activity. Besides this new, highly annoying, nonsensical feature Strava is the greatest distance and elevation tracking app available. If you bike, run, or hike I highly recommend it (assuming they FIX THE START FEATURE).

helpful_reviews.title: Almost great
helpful_reviews.author: obliviRUS
helpful_reviews.content: Log my rides with my bike computer that sync to Strava. Great for keeping up with your friends. Gave up on Strava being able to sync workout/ride data to iOS Health - constantly duplicated workout and distance entries. It does, however, read data from Health without issue (for example weight, etc) that are provided by other devices/apps. I rely on the bike computer app (Wahoo) to sync workout data to Health which it manages to do correctly without issue. Ride analysis, once the ride data is in Strava, is top notch and easy to interpret. I do wish Strava was a little more featured for logging workouts that are not cycling, running or swimming.  Otherwise a solid, informative and fun app.

helpful_reviews.title: Great tracking tool
helpful_reviews.author: Bike enthusiast
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve been using Strava for three or four years. The first couple of years, I kept up my handwritten journal record of each ride, but then just sort of stopped, because I can describe each ride and add photos on Strava, so why bother? My only fear is what if Strava goes away and then I lose all that history? I wish I could make a printed album of all my Strava rides! One thing that Strava brings out for better or for worse is my competitive nature. Sometimes I am shocked that I am top ten in a segment that I didnâ€™t even know existed, and then I try to better my time and ride stupidly instead of safely.

helpful_reviews.title: Please - Apple Watch features needed!
helpful_reviews.author: Teeleerunner
helpful_reviews.content: I absolutely love the Strava app, but I have to remove a star for three main concerns.  1. When I go for a run and then sync from my Apple Watch to Strava, my mile times and overall pace change. I will go running with someone else who has been side by side with me, but after I sync, Iâ€™m magically 10 seconds per mile faster.  2. PLEASE give us current pace, not just the predicted split time and overall pace on the Apple Watch.  3. Again, PLEASE, hundredths of a mile on the Apple Watch display (2.95 instead of 2.9). Itâ€™s annoying not knowing how close I am to my next tenth of a mile, especially when Iâ€™m doing speedwork and need to work in smaller numbers.

helpful_reviews.title: Social Media for Cyclists
helpful_reviews.author: Yellow Klein
helpful_reviews.content: I am a Strava junkie. I joined 2 years ago out of desperation to see what my husband was doing online for an hour after he came in from a long weekend ride. What I found was a global cycling community that does fascinating rides and posts terrific photos. I follow Tour de France pros and British housewives who create art with their routes and my local club buddies. I pit myself against climbing hotshots and mega-milers, happy to just be somewhere on a list with them. I upgraded to a Garmin 520 and I use a Garmin heart rate monitor. I sync with my iPhone and other than the occasional glitch overseas, I have had no trouble. And my marriage is better than ever!

helpful_reviews.title: Please add verbal turn-by-turn directions
helpful_reviews.author: crwdstrct
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve used this app a few times on some really long bike routes for races and would have been totally screwed on race day if it wasnâ€™t for painted road markers. Itâ€™s a great app for doing routes you already know by heart and for recording a freestyle route but trying to match somebody elseâ€™s in a city or part of town youâ€™ve never been in can be very tedious and frustrating when you have to check your phone to make sure youâ€™re still on course. But if you know everything and youâ€™re a human GPS, this app can take you to the next level.

helpful_reviews.title: Non-responsive customer service.
helpful_reviews.author: Alchemy2u
helpful_reviews.content: The app works well for tacking your workouts, but I accidentally signed up for the premium service. I had put the phone in my pocket while loading a ride. When I looked at it was asking for my fingerprint. Thought it was locked and I would just go ahead and open it. But instead I guess I pocket requested the premium service and my fingerprint was accepting the charge. The bill rang on my phone immediately and then I realized my error. I notified Strava within 5 minutes and twice more the next two days. I finally got a response saying they have consolidated my 3 tickets into one.  All they have said is they are working hard to get to my request as soon as possible. It has now been over a week and nothing new.  It is getting to late to cancel the CC payment. Can Apple help?

helpful_reviews.title: 5â­�ï¸� app
helpful_reviews.author: CG Utah
helpful_reviews.content: This is one of the best cycling/running apps that I have used over the years. It can track your location mid ride/run if you check it often and it doesnâ€™t take much time to load ( 30 secs top). It does have one downside though, it is that you have to use the internet on you phone or computer to put in your gear. It also has a social thing where you can see what you or your friends are doing or see where they have been riding/running that week. Overall this is a very good app and I highly suggest downloading it. So have fun and happy trails everyone.

helpful_reviews.title: Should be 5 stars but...
helpful_reviews.author: oceanminded28
helpful_reviews.content: I have been a Strava user for about 2 years and love it for the most part. I am rating it a single star because the engineers need to get their stuff together. I am trying premium for this month as the free thing but donâ€™t see a need to keep it and pay anything when there is no true integration between the Apple Watch and the iPhone app. Many apps have the watch and phone apps sync up with no issue and yet I read on the Strava website that Strava puts this feature with low priority. So the dilemma is use the iPhone app so you can use the beacon, but no heart rate is recorded, or use the watch app to get the heart rate but loose beacon and you canâ€™t see where you are in the route. Not enticing to pay for an app that wonâ€™t integrate fully. Needless to say I wonâ€™t be continuing with premium until this is remedied.

helpful_reviews.title: No Apple Watch Heart Rate Monitor when Using Phone App
helpful_reviews.author: counter5th
helpful_reviews.content: Why canâ€™t I use the Apple Watch for heart rate analysis while using the iPhone app? This is a critical missing function! I was under the impression that this was possible with this app so I paid for the premium membership. Turns out, you only get heart rate analysis when using the Watch app. The watch app is more dumbed down as it only lets you select from a few predefined activities. After my ride with the watch I have to open up the phone app and edit in all the missing details like equipment used. You also can not select a route on the watch! I will be going back to Cyclemeter where I get all of the analysis info on my phone screen and the heart rate from my watch at a 1/5 of the price.

helpful_reviews.title: Great App
helpful_reviews.author: Kdbaseball
helpful_reviews.content: Love the app. Use it daily and have for years. I am a premium member. Iâ€™d like to see a filter on my activities so I could filter by distance and pace to see different runs. For example runs between 10-15 miles or between 7-7:15 pace. Also I think it would be cool to have a map page that has a pin on a world map with all the spots you logged a run. You could then click on the pin to see the activity.   I believe the website has something like this but I rarely use the website.    Thanks again for a wonderful app and the constant improvements.

helpful_reviews.title: Apple Watch app needs improvements
helpful_reviews.author: Ninja say what?!
helpful_reviews.content: I run only with my cellular Apple Watch and AirPods to track my runs with Strava but the app is lacking. For a fitness app that tracks so many stats it will be nice for some custom options to view on the Watch app like cadence and alarms for pace and distance markers. Music integration on a separate page will be a great add on as I have to switch apps on the watch while running and it can effect my pace to do that. Overall Iâ€™m happy with the Strava app on the iPhone with the PRs and segment times that are great to see improvements. It can be better and these are some things that the basic fitness app on the Apple Watch includes.

helpful_reviews.title: Love it but currently needs a bug fix
helpful_reviews.author: Fireballburrito
helpful_reviews.content: Okay so this app rocks, Iâ€™ve been getting more friends to use it and we all have a lot of fun with it. My only complaint is that Iâ€™m currently having an issue with the gps reliability. More often than not now, Iâ€™ll start recording for a bike ride, and for the first mile or two, it wonâ€™t actually track me. So then when it eventually starts working, thereâ€™s just a straight diagonal line from where I start to where the Gps starts working properly. So Iâ€™m losing ride time, distance, and segment challenges. If they could fix this bug in an update soon, that would be very much appreciated.

helpful_reviews.title: This is the worst company and the worst app
helpful_reviews.author: PolarBearKev
helpful_reviews.content: This company refuses to listen to its customers, refused to support people who cannot run or who cannot bike. There are millions of people who due to physical limitation or age, cannot run or bike. On this companies forums there are a multitude of people who have requested walks be added as an activity, from 2012 to the present day nothing has been done and the company continues to ignore its customers. What does this say about this company? It says they donâ€™t care, they do what they want to do. I used to pay for a subscription to Strava, but after seeing the way this company treats its users, the people who write their paycheck, I canceled my subscription and went with a competing product. If you canâ€™t listen to your customers you donâ€™t deserve to be doing business with anyone! Itâ€™s an absolute disgrace!

helpful_reviews.title: With small improvements it will be miles away from the competition
helpful_reviews.author: vicenac
helpful_reviews.content: Unlike with other biking apps, I haven't run into any bugs with Strava. Some might complain about the accuracy of measurenents, etc. But the ap works wonderfully and the community of friendly competitors helps push one further.  I wish it would do turn by turn directions. You can make a route in the computer and then use it to ride but the map does not rotate in the direction of travel.  I'd like Strava to use Apple Maps for directions and provide on the fly detections and recalculations.

helpful_reviews.title: Love this but please read this developers
helpful_reviews.author: Derppera
helpful_reviews.content: This app has made my cycling way more enjoyable when I get back and get to share where I have been to my friends and.... strangers? One thing I donâ€™t like is that anyone can see exactly where I live. It would be very appreciated if there was an option to grey out a vicinity around my neighborhood or maybe 2500ft radius around my home. It concerns me that I can see peopleâ€™s starting point which is quite commonly their own home. Please let me know if you take this review into consideration. I would greatly appreciate it. Thank you. -Kurt

helpful_reviews.title: I use to love this app
helpful_reviews.author: chazubell
helpful_reviews.content: What with the last few updates to both this app and to iOS the application keeps on dying while I am using it.   I would start my run and by the time I reached the half mile point I wouldnâ€™t hear any indication and I would look at the iPhone screen and not see the little blue bar at the top of the display. I knew at that point that Strava  had stopped working and it would need to be restarted. This happened several times over the last few days and it is far too frustrating and annoying so I have moved on to other running apps. I had submitted a previous bug report which was to update my iPhone to the latest version of iOS (which I did) however that did not fully fix the problem.  By the wayI had already paid for a subscription.

helpful_reviews.title: Stay free, donâ€™t pay for Summit
helpful_reviews.author: youknownino
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve been using the free version of Strava for a few years, but only just upgraded to â€œPremiumâ€� with their announcement of Summit. Since my upgrade Iâ€™ve had nothing but problems and have had zero responses from customer/technical support â€” despite their promise that my Summit membership comes with â€œexpedited assistance from our Support Team.â€�  What make me laugh is that I actually wanted to spend more money with them and they wonâ€™t get back to me... my entire issue has been adding two more packages to my account because the package I did buy (Analysis) isnâ€™t what they sold it as.   My recommendation is to skip the Premium Summit garbage because the features arenâ€™t much and the support and customer care you receive is nonexistent. Itâ€™s a great free app but not worth paying for.

helpful_reviews.title: Hero to Zero !
helpful_reviews.author: Blucrabdeb
helpful_reviews.content: I manage a bicycle shop and have personally introduced and recommended Strava to 100â€™s of cyclists. There were many great features, with lots of detailed data and useful information. Unfortunately the most unique feature, which was being able to compete with your friends and foes for trophies and top times, etc... has recently been rendered mostly useless!! This is a huge disappointment and unfortunate recent change to the App :-(((( Now most of the segments are not even possible to find. There are other Apps that do a lot of the same things you get in Strava. Unless they bring back the segment explore features to their previous functionality it will continue to be a very disappointing app!!!!

helpful_reviews.title: I love Strava
helpful_reviews.author: foor4foor
helpful_reviews.content: I love Strava and the only thing holding me back from five stars are two things. I wish rucking was an option instead of just hiking. I have already submitted a request after inquiring about this in the past. And, I wish there was a spot somewhere that would tell you your total monthly mileage for running/walking/cycling and not just weekly totals. Nike Run Club does a nice job with the monthly/weekly/last month/last week totals. Thatâ€™s one of the main reasons Iâ€™ve kept Nike Run Club is for that feature. I do, however, love Strava, and know the updates will continue to make it a great product. Thanks, Strava!

helpful_reviews.title: What happened in version 58??
helpful_reviews.author: jdhsuiwbwhdhdi
helpful_reviews.content: Ive used Strava for about 4 years and its been excellent, very happy with both running and biking activities.  But all of a sudden ver 58 and 59 the GPS tracking basically doesnt work.  Iâ€™ll start an activity, it will record my time for the whole duration, but misses half of the distance traveled (ive only been running recently).  The weird thing today, before i saved my activity the map preview actually showed the whole route even though the distance was wrong, but then when i saved it the map changed to a completely different path.  Please fix the app and ill be happy to change my review to 5 stars (if thats possible)!

helpful_reviews.title: Had become a so so all
helpful_reviews.author: NRJ18
helpful_reviews.content: This use to be a  good app but itâ€™s trying to become like Facebook rather  than an athletic  one app.  The â€œsuggested followâ€� is annoying as hell. The inability of the app to go beyond 1 decimal point  is annoying. Strava  will also scrub mileage and speed off may activities. The app forces  you to go online to add things like Shoes etc. this is something that you can do on Garmin. The 3 premium subscription is set up to charge you more in the near future. While this was the best  app years  ago  it has not made any real improvement in years while others have.  Garmin will give you all the Premium data like â€œsafetyâ€� for free. Strava charges $2/month.

helpful_reviews.title: Crashes needs to be fixed
helpful_reviews.author: Lecaire2017
helpful_reviews.content: Strava is great, canâ€™t argue with that; *however* whenever i try to add photos to an activity, it just crashes as i am choosing the photo. I am running ios 11.2.6 on iphone 6 plus (been happening on previous versions and same issue on my other 4s device), this has been happening to me for more than 6 months now and i let it go cause it works after several attempts and hope that in the next update it will be fixed, it doesnâ€™t.  Nothing wrong with importing photos to any other app ever no matter how much apps are running. Just fix it.

helpful_reviews.title: Private messaging
helpful_reviews.author: chnshdjfndjnc
helpful_reviews.content: I think a private massaging function should be added because you can keep in touch with people better. Iâ€™m on a cross country team and my friend missed practice and he goes to a different school so it is hard for him to get there on time. Or we have early releases and he doesnâ€™t, so sadly I didnâ€™t get to run with him today. But our coach wanted me to tell him that he needs to run for 30 minutes, but I canâ€™t because there is no private messaging function!!!!!! Overall I think the app is great but could use work. Sorry that I was kind of all over the place on that.

helpful_reviews.title: Needs an alert feature for ending a ride
helpful_reviews.author: TheMaggieMoo
helpful_reviews.content: I use this app almost daily for biking and love almost everything about it. The one thing that drives me crazy is that often I will forget to "end" a ride when I get back to my car, and the app logs my speed and route while driving, thus ruining the overall stats of my ride. There's got to be a way for the app to sense that you're suddenly going 65mph and at the very least send a notification asking if you've stopped biking. Or make rides editable so I can go in after the fact and delete segments that weren't actually part of my ride.

helpful_reviews.title: Good... But
helpful_reviews.author: scootdogg72
helpful_reviews.content: This has been one of the more comprehensive workout apps. I have 2 suggestions: include .01 miles for runners, and make the watch app a little less finicky. I'm always struggling to get it to start up at the beginning of a workout, or after pausing to restart. That can cost valuable time when you're doing speed workouts... I've seen some apps use a twist of the dial for starting or stopping, or a hard press on the face. Either way would work better than tapping a tiny icon and hoping for the best. I love the app, especially the social aspect, it just needs some fine tuning.

helpful_reviews.title: Does what it's meant for well
helpful_reviews.author: Kyrah A
helpful_reviews.content: While so many apps I've tried boast about the bells and whistles they've been able to incorporate, Strava has taken a more less is more approach. They track runs accurately, analyze data and provide helpful feedback. While my NikePlus friends list was longer, my real life engagement with the few Strava followers is far more meaningful and beneficial to my running goals. I'd categorize Strava as an app for real runners. Skip the frills and just run.  I'm a fan of this app and look forward to years of running with it.

helpful_reviews.title: Strava rocks
helpful_reviews.author: stroffeapps
helpful_reviews.content: I have been out of road cycling for about 30 years, been mountain biking, but decided it was time to get back into the pure exhilaration that is road cycling. I had a friend recommend Strava. Did the free version for a month and moved over to premium. Iâ€™ve had no issues with usability or sophistication. The app gives you what you need to grow or just maintain. The only fault I have found has to do with gps accuracy not the strava app. Velocities seem to be off by 3-5 mph on hard descents. Then again, fast is just fast. Overall a great app.

helpful_reviews.title: Great app
helpful_reviews.author: Loki's Human
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve been using strava for some time to track walks and runs with my dog. The free version does what I need: tracks distance, time spent daily, and since I started using the app. Itâ€™s intuitive and easy to use. However, after the recent update it looks like I have an alert waiting (the bell icon is filled in and has a number on it). When I click on it there is just a blank screen- no message. Maybe just a glitch in the build? Other than this little snafu I really like this app and highly recommend.

helpful_reviews.title: Great, but leaves out Equestrian activities
helpful_reviews.author: bumblebuddy
helpful_reviews.content: I do competitive long-distance equestrian competitions, called Endurance Riding. I use the free version to track my distance and average speed while training and during competition... itâ€™s really great for that, and I love how you donâ€™t get pestered with pop-ups to upgrade.  However, I have to log my sport as bicycle riding since there is no option for equestrian (kayaking, snowboarding, ice skating, THREE different kinds of skiing... even â€œvirtual ridesâ€� are available as options), which is a disappointment. I would be thrilled to be able to correctly log my sport of choice.

helpful_reviews.title: Almost Perfect!
helpful_reviews.author: Grimalal
helpful_reviews.content: Bottom line I love the Strava app, Iâ€™ve used it on my iPhone and Apple Watch since 2015, mainly for biking, and highly recommended it. I would like a few improvements for 5 stars, mainly to the Apple Watch portion.  1. I use it to track my commutes as well as my longer rides and Iâ€™d very much appreciate that the auto-pause functionality didnâ€™t dim everything on the watch screen (stop at a light and I look down to check my heart rate, distance, etc. and I canâ€™t see any of it because of the auto-stop dimming). 2. Let me tag commutes from the watch screen when I finish a ride, going into the app later to do this is just annoying. 3. Fix the bug that gives me like 4 alerts on my watch in the first minute of a ride that my ride is ready to upload if I open the iPhone app.  Again, I highly recommend this app, although beware if you get it youâ€™ll probably quickly go premium like I did ğŸ˜‚. Also worth it in my opinion.

helpful_reviews.title: Seriously Underwhelming
helpful_reviews.author: Pedeclaudo
helpful_reviews.content: I don't get itâ€”why does everyone rave about this app? It's okay, but it has less than half of the useful features of MyMyFitness. For instance, the voice feedback is a joke. You get your choice of splits and... nope, that's it. You can get splits at every mile or every half mile. Contrast that with MapMyFitness, which gives you seven options and eight interval choices at either distances or times. What about coaching? Forget it. Paying for premium is a total ripoff. There isn't even a delayed start option. Maybe the social media aspect is more appealing to some people, but UA has that covered too. There's just no questionâ€”when it come to fitness tracking, Strava can't compete.

helpful_reviews.title: Live HR removed for non-premium users
helpful_reviews.author: Oliyay
helpful_reviews.content: Without any announcement the Apple Watch functionality of seeing your live HR was removed for non-premium users. Now you can only see your average HR.  I understand Strava needs to make a profit somehow, but it feels like charging the premium subscription for a really basic functionality to, arguably, mostly occasional users is not the way to make people willing to go premium.  Anyway, thanks for ruining that workout for me as I was constantly trying to figure out why my HR wasnâ€™t responding to what I was doing. Not seeing you HR drop after you stop running is quite concerning to say the least. At least make an announcement on such a change of functionality.

helpful_reviews.title: Good but not great.
helpful_reviews.author: pandrewsvieira
helpful_reviews.content: First off, this app does log your rides really well. I guess if that is all you are looking for then awesome.   Paying for premium on the other hand is really only worth it for me specifically because of the beacon feature. Unfortunately they have not integrated that feature into the Apple Watch and youâ€™re left to use both the phone and the watch and end up logging two separate rides. I want the app on the watch to send the beacon text automatically as I start riding.   Strava, please fix this. Iâ€™ve seen other people complain about it, for over a year and yet nothing has been done.

helpful_reviews.title: Doesn't work with watch and phone together
helpful_reviews.author: wulfmeister
helpful_reviews.content: You have to pick recording a run/cycle on either the watch app or the phone app. You can't view the map or stats on the phone while also recording heart rate data on the watch at the same time. Kind of lame.  Also, allowing data to be written to the Health app causes data overlap when recording with the phone, where the calories burned are added from the Strava app, but also added from the watch's "active energy" reading.  I've ended up using the Exercise app on the watch to record the workout to Apple Health with heart rate data, while using Strava with Health permissions disabled on the phone just to track the route. Which kind of makes purchasing Premium pointless

helpful_reviews.title: Simple functional adds would make this great
helpful_reviews.author: JonnyOO
helpful_reviews.content: I have premium version. Use the app frequently - paying seemed fair. However, not really convinced premium features are worth the extra.  One feature that would be super useful would be to be able to select the specific segment you are on out of your starred segments while on a ride. Does not do this today and often multiple over lapping segments mean you donâ€™t get to see how you are doing on the segment you actually want.  Also battery drain seems pretty bad. Running iPhone 7+.

helpful_reviews.title: Great tracking and social aspects
helpful_reviews.author: s.b.a.l.l.
helpful_reviews.content: Great sharing and tracking features. Love the auto pause on the Apple Watch and phone on bike rides.  Issue that is very frustrating is that there is no option to distinguish between different types of biking. I regularly go on road bike rides and mountain bike rides and obviously my speed and effort vary greatly between the two; however there is no way to distinguish between the two in order to track progress.  Additionally, the calorie count populated as zero for exercise on the Apple Watch which is frustrating.

helpful_reviews.title: Cursed Updates!
helpful_reviews.author: damurderouspotato
helpful_reviews.content: Curse these cursed updates! I had Strava working more or less how I wanted on iPhone and Apple Watch: no notifications on the phone and yes haptic response on mile markers on the watch. After this update, I have yet to get the same per mile notifications on the watch, even with the phone buzzing every time anyone adds a â€œkudosâ€� to any activity. ğŸ¤¬ğŸ¤¬ğŸ¤¬. I really wish I could go back in time to the functionality I preferred.   Oh, also, I still yearn for an actual current pace, not just average overall or average for current mile. Makes it tough to adjust pacing without guess work while running.

helpful_reviews.title: Fails to record mileage and ave speed
helpful_reviews.author: seagreenlaw
helpful_reviews.content: When itâ€™s working properly, itâ€™s a great app. I particularly like the segments function, which really motivates me to up my ride. However, Iâ€™ve had multiple problems with this app and have read the various threads online where people have reported similar issues, such as the app failing to show your average speed and your mileage during your ride, often resulting in the app only partially recording your total mileage (very frustrating when competing against others in a monthly mileage challenge). Stravaâ€™s developers need to fix these recurring issues or theyâ€™ll lose more riders and runners to competitors like Map My Ride.

helpful_reviews.title: Very very happy.  Nice product.
helpful_reviews.author: Acct manager
helpful_reviews.content: My I watch interface works very well with the newest updates.  My I phone works flawlessly.   It interfaces with My Fitness pall and my weight scale.   I have used this product for years and only have one request.  I dont know how hard it would be, but could you please rotate the screen when using horizontally.  This would be especially helpful when using my IPad with keyboard.  I would not have to lay my head sideways to watch the screen.  Otherwise, this is a great product.  Thank you for your excellent work.

helpful_reviews.title: No routing in app?
helpful_reviews.author: Cpindc
helpful_reviews.content: I got Strava because I thought it could easily help me find routes for biking, Iâ€™m trying to make biking more of a part of my fitness routine. Having to get on a desktop computer to set routes adds way too much friction to what should be something fairly easy to do on a phone. I signed up for the premium trial (happy to pay for something thatâ€™s useful), but Iâ€™ll probably cancel it if I can find an app that will help map bike routes on my phone (I think even Google maps and Waze have a basic version of this, I thought with the popularity of Strava theyâ€™d offer something better).

helpful_reviews.title: Latest Update
helpful_reviews.author: OnD'Hunt
helpful_reviews.content: Really enjoy the app for connecting with my running friends near and far! I use a  Garmin watch to collect the data but almost never look at the Garmin app.  Look at Strava instead. We always say if it is not on Strava it did not happen!  One note for you, with most recent update the mile split bar graph has the bars getting longer the faster you go. That seems counterintuitive to me. I prefer the way it used to be where the bra got shorter the faster you go!

helpful_reviews.title: Does anyone do QA at Strava?!?
helpful_reviews.author: gifflerr
helpful_reviews.content: For a leading app this has got to have the shoddiest development team of all. Over the past 5 years I have experienced bug after bug after bug with this app. If itâ€™s not runs or rides being left unrecorded (even though time and waypoints are being reached) itâ€™s the announcement voice going all 1995-robo all of a sudden. The iOS 12 beta was out for over 2 months ago, am i to believe that none of these issues were present in testing? A more likely scenario is that the reactive Strava development team didnâ€™t even bother to test. Shameful. Get it together Strava, hire a new QA lead and maybe two dozen more developers while youâ€™re at it. Humph.

helpful_reviews.title: Like it
helpful_reviews.author: Drking25
helpful_reviews.content: I like strava, getting to see what your friends are doing is an encouragement to work hard, and somewhat of an accountability to keep the fitness going. ***Recommendation: I do wish that strava would enable a lock screen ability so that I can quickly check my pace, distance etc with raising my phone instead of having to try and dry my finger print off while running to unlock the phone and check. If strava had this function it would be top notch fitness app in my mind! Can you make it happen strava team?!

helpful_reviews.title: Quality app but lacks in price &
helpful_reviews.author: lost7spirit
helpful_reviews.content: Donâ€™t get me wrong this app is well thought out and is a quality app and performers like a tracking app should. Iâ€™ve moved from mapmyrun to Strava thinking this app would offer something more. I like the personal record metals and live tracking on other users, but I donâ€™t like how easy it has been to mess my tracking and not be able to enter manually or pre-calculate my distance in order to continue tracking my progress. If you pay for this app it would be nice to set up a group class for beginners to experts cyclists and win local prizes etc.

helpful_reviews.title: Needs Improvement
helpful_reviews.author: evansdad
helpful_reviews.content: I use this with my Apple Watch when running (without the iPhone). When I raise my wrist to check distance or pace the run will automatically pause even though Iâ€™m still running. After the run thereâ€™s a message to save or delete the run, but the buttons are small and the delete button is the same size as the save button so itâ€™s too easy to accidentally delete your run (yes, Iâ€™ve done it). When I get back home it takes a long time to get the run on the Watch to sync with the phone so I can check splits and stuff. Itâ€™s frustrating!

helpful_reviews.title: Love Strava
helpful_reviews.author: Adietran
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve been using Strava for the longest time. Used others app but always return to Strava because the design is nice, clean and not too much layers menu but more importantly not those flashy adds. But I do want some improvement. For example, I canâ€™t import route that my friends send over to me I would have to use desktop to create the route. Also I have Apple Watch but I canâ€™t use swim mode. It only exist on phone, why? I canâ€™t carry my phone when I swim ğŸ˜‚.

helpful_reviews.title: Watch app needs some work
helpful_reviews.author: adl_runs
helpful_reviews.content: I tried using the Strava app on my Apple Watch series 2 for several runs and it consistently would not start mapping mileage until a quarter mile or more into the run. You never find out it is doing this until after the run is uploaded once Iâ€™m back at my phone. Extremely annoying because it shows my pace to be much faster than it actually is. There needs to be an indicator showing when GPS is acquired so I know when to start my run. I was not in a wooded area when this occurred each time. For now I am going to use the native workout app and then upload to Strava using another app.

helpful_reviews.title: Mostly reliable
helpful_reviews.author: dA fRESH150
helpful_reviews.content: It would be nice if Strava worked on an indoor track- for some reason whenever Iâ€™ve tried to log miles indoors, Strava usually doesnâ€™t record anything, but one time it got about half my run. I usually run alone, and where winter is coming and daylight hours are decreasing, Iâ€™m a lot safer running indoors, but I canâ€™t track my mileage as accurately. Otherwise, the GPS has worked great for me most of the time- there have been 2 races though where there was some glitch and Strava missed most of my mileage (but got all of my time), but usually it works fine.

helpful_reviews.title: Very reliable
helpful_reviews.author: Adaretpdx
helpful_reviews.content: I use this with my Apple Watch Series 2. The distances are always consistent with running, cycling and walking. It can take a few minutes for the heart rate to show up on the watch interface and there are times when the HR is inaccurate but thatâ€™s a function of Apples watch.  It would also be helpful to be able to print out your workout diary. So far I have not seen this functionality but there are (from what Iâ€™ve read), some workarounds.   I have used Wahoo (which wasnâ€™t bad), Garmin, Polar, Under Armor (which crashed a lot), RunKeeper (also stopped Working mid-run).   This has been the most consistently reliable app for exercise that I have used. I am a Premium member and while there are improvements that could be made, I can wait for them because this app is overall pretty solid.

helpful_reviews.title: Problem with Apple Watch
helpful_reviews.author: ericpga
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™m a fervent and frequent user of Strava, particularly using its Apple Watch app. Unfortunately after this release, the Strava in Apple Watch is quite buggy, constantly de-installing itself from the Watch, including in mid-routines, which unfortunately in my case I discovered in the middle of my weekly long run; What was my surprise that even though the Apple Wath app started running smoothly (which I doubled checked given the recent de-installations), it looks like somewhere thru my running, it deinstalled, NOT recording anything of my routine. I hope they solve this bugs so I can starting using/trusting again the Appel Watch version.

helpful_reviews.title: Great running app but unacceptably inaccurate
helpful_reviews.author: gelbin
helpful_reviews.content: I have used the app on phone and watch for years now. Using the watch app with series two Apple Watch in two recent marathons has convinced me that it is inaccurate and consistently overestimates your pace/distance. Both marathons it was ahead of the distance by roughly 5-10 percent.  Unfortunately this makes the app useless for races and not ideal for training.  I love the appâ€™s simplicity and mike split notifications etc along with stravaâ€™s community. It just doesnâ€™t make the cut for an accurate gps running experience. Hereâ€™s hoping that one day...

helpful_reviews.title: Apple Watch App Is Bad
helpful_reviews.author: Chones
helpful_reviews.content: The functionality of both the iPhone & Apple Watch app work well. There is sometimes a lag between syncing if you donâ€™t take your phone with you on a run & have to manually sync. But other than that everything works ok.  The low rating is specifically for the Strava Apple Watch app.   It needs to be updated to take advantage of all the things that the watch is capable of which isnâ€™t a lot but Watch OS5 does have some evolutionarily advancements that Strava ought to take advantage of.  As it stands, the Strava watch app is very basic. For example, there should be an option for interval training or perhaps  It wouldnâ€™t be too difficult to add that functionality to the outdoor run section. Or how about the ability to gauge cadence with Watch OS5? These are very basic quality of life improvements that Strava engineers could easily patch into a future fix...but itâ€™s been years with this outdated, behind the curve basic watch app which is a shame because most runners I know use Strava to track their workouts exclusively.

helpful_reviews.title: Nothing is perfect...
helpful_reviews.author: gnomeofzurich
helpful_reviews.content: ...but Strava Premium/Peak is close enough to it for my purposes to get 5 stars!  Interval training is the shizzy!!!  The ability for the community to police itself on segments that were obviously done in cars w/o user shutting off the app seems to work well.  I see with each passing day more e-bikes out on the roads & trails so I hope you folks are working on some genius way to keep these from compromising the integrity of KOM boards. All in all I tip my cap to the developers. Great app!

helpful_reviews.title: Good not great
helpful_reviews.author: Rachbrownie
helpful_reviews.content: I used to love this app - seeing my progress on the segments I run often is particularly cool - but the last handful of runs Iâ€™ve gone on the app isnâ€™t picking up my gps even though it says it is. Frustrating to the point that Iâ€™d rather not bother with it. The other thing that bothers me is the lack of options as far as the voice cues are concerned. You can really only choose between half mile and mile splits but it would be nice to have time interval cues as a choice. I also wish you could set the distance or time of your run and get light coaching cues along the way.

helpful_reviews.title: Route planning
helpful_reviews.author: Portiblo
helpful_reviews.content: The Strava app is great as it works now. I would like to see an addition to be able to plan routes with the app, drawing runs, rides, swim sessions on the map with our fingers. That way if our route wonâ€™t sink up because a malfunction occurs with our watch, or we forget our phone and watch for a run, or want to plan a new route somewhere the. We can still upload the route and see exactly how far our distance travelled was.

helpful_reviews.title: Technical difficulties
helpful_reviews.author: Acai-isaiah
helpful_reviews.content: I have been using strava so much throughout this year to help me train with my cross county team. It is one of the best running apps out there and it really makes non runners like my mom want to get the virtual badges. I ran into this problem a while ago and I noticed it when I went running and it said it was tracking my run but it wouldnâ€™t show where Iâ€™ve been or tracked my distance, which make my runs very annoying because I wouldnâ€™t know my splits or my distance/pace. It is a bug i found but maybe for others it doesnâ€™t affect them. I have re downloaded the app so hopefully it changes

helpful_reviews.title: Strava Problems
helpful_reviews.author: Porshe 217
helpful_reviews.content: Seems to pick and choose days it will work/not work. I know strava isn't the MOST accurate when it comes to tracking  your time and miles. But when I pay for the premium I expect it to actually track my results. Instead I come back home only to realize that after 2 hours of riding it didn't record a single mile. You're honestly just better off getting a bike computer.

helpful_reviews.title: Still great, but slightly less so
helpful_reviews.author: kpeters0n
helpful_reviews.content: I still think this is the best app for tracking cycling, but I donâ€™t like the change to the â€œStartâ€� screen on the Apple Watch app. You used to be able to set your preferred type of workout, and then the â€œStartâ€� screen was a big easy-to-push button. The updated version of the Apple Watch app took that away, and I wish they would bring the big â€œStartâ€� button back for people (like me) who mainly use the app to track one type of activity.

helpful_reviews.title: Strava is Hot Lava!
helpful_reviews.author: 14Stltpc$
helpful_reviews.content: Ok, it's the most random review title ever but Strava is a great app. All the cool kids use it! I like having the ability to track my runs right from my smart phone. One of the best features is Strava keeps track of the mileage I put on each pair of my running shoes so I know when it's time to phase them out. It's also a great way to see what other routes folks run to get ideas for different runs. Also fun to offer support and motivation amongst other runners.

helpful_reviews.title: Great app with one huge flaw.
helpful_reviews.author: Luish80
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™m training for a triathlon and was given a few recommendations for this app to give me a little more motivation. So far itâ€™s worked great with the running and cycling, I have it linked to my Apple Watch and it gives me all the stats I need and more. My only complaint (and itâ€™s a BIG one) is that it doesnâ€™t allow you to track your swimming on the watch. You can do so on your phone (somehow. I dunno, swim with my phone shoved down my shorts maybe?)  Come on Strava, sorely it canâ€™t be that difficult. Hell, if you fixed that Iâ€™d be more likely to subscribe to the upgrades you have on offer in the app.

helpful_reviews.title: Serious problems.
helpful_reviews.author: Jason Simpson
helpful_reviews.content: Problems again, but I did have a good 3 months of proper tracking. Not itâ€™s split between being pretty close to accurate, to completely crazy & all over the place. I still want to use this app, but itâ€™s getting harder & harder to support it, since itâ€™s become so temperamental & hard to trust. I will be trying out alternate apps now...  â€”â€”â€” Old 1* review; For the last 5 months or so, with a few days here and there of working properly, Strava or iPhone has been unable to properly keep track of my distance. It just goes crazy & puts random lines all over the place. It was a 5 Star app, but lately its just been a disappointment. Made walking not so much fun. Fix it & youâ€™ll get your 5 Star back.   â€”â€”â€”â€” Old 5* review: I use this app daily, but I can't run. I have to use the run option for it to keep up with my miles daily / yearly. Wish there was an option to change this.

helpful_reviews.title: Strava is getting worse
helpful_reviews.author: ROSEJP79
helpful_reviews.content: I was a premium member for 6 years, and cancelled it this year.  Strava has slowly been removing capabilities over time.  One example is the option to search/explore strava segments in a specific area.  Whatâ€™s the point if you canâ€™t look for segments in your neighborhood.   Customers have asked for options such as the ability to filter out unwanted activities (like swimming or yoga, no one cares), but strava has not responded.  There are more and more ads of course.  Iâ€™ve read a lot of stravaâ€™s forums, maybe strava should as well.    Strava switched to an algorithm, which shows random activities on my feed vice showing my friends activities in chronological order. I donâ€™t care about their rides from last week, I want to see this weekendâ€™s rides on my feed.   Adding photos to activities was a good touch though. I like that.   Strava is no longer worth my money. I use the free version occasionally, but Iâ€™m definitely not on it like I used too.

helpful_reviews.title: Next and Previous
helpful_reviews.author: Dwm206
helpful_reviews.content: This kind of drives me nuts.  When you are looking at an individual activity there should be a previous and next button so u donâ€™t have to go back to the feed.  When Iâ€™m looking at only my activities in my feed and I look at one of my rides the previous and next should only sequence through my rides.  When I start from the general feed and look at one ride previous and next should sequence through the individual rides from the general feed

helpful_reviews.title: Donâ€™t listen to customers
helpful_reviews.author: AUHansel
helpful_reviews.content: Strava is great in many ways, but listening to customer feedback has always been TERRIBLE! On the Strava Support page, people have been asking for YEARS for them to add other categories of activities like Triathlon, Mountain Biking, Trail Running, Obstacle Racing, etc... It seems like such an easy thing to do since they have added activities in the past few years like SUP, Crossfit, and Kayaking. Itâ€™s not a huge ask, but weâ€™ve been ignored for years. I really like segments, but if they don't start listening to their paid customers, I'll be switching to another app, and suggesting my friends do as well.

helpful_reviews.title: Love it
helpful_reviews.author: Kwardy
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve been using Strava since itâ€™s inception. Sure there are a few glitches here and there with the interface, but those who complain Strava drops off part way through a ride, itâ€™s not Strava- itâ€™s your phone. There is no other app out there that allows me to track my training, and keep track of my friends and competitionâ€™s activities. It is an amazing venue to follow pro athletes who are willing to share their training

helpful_reviews.title: Compete against friends and during races for free
helpful_reviews.author: Rem6a
helpful_reviews.content: Traveling for work, Strava lets me find local trails and segments I didn't know existed. Plus, the after run performance goals are very cool and accurate. Also fun to see how you compare to others during races, triathlons, obstacle races and many others.

helpful_reviews.title: Excellent update
helpful_reviews.author: VeloMat
helpful_reviews.content: Strava has done a great job with this update. I have been using Strava for many moons. This is a big update and they knocked it out of the park. I love how you can easily swipe through pictures and the feed is cleaner and more informative. I checked the website and it has also been updated. Now all they need to do is integrate a messaging into Strava so we donâ€™t have to leave private stuff in the very public comments.

helpful_reviews.title: Good app, a few bugs
helpful_reviews.author: august_gau
helpful_reviews.content: I use strava almost daily for my commutes, and enjoy it a good bit. iâ€™ve had recurring problems with strava not recognizing my heart rate from my Apple watch. iâ€™ve already done everything to make sure there should be no communication errors. strava thinks i donâ€™t have a heart rate monitor at all, which is obviously not the case, but, i havenâ€™t been able to find a solution.   Apart from that, i love the app. would definitely give a five star rating if that wasnâ€™t an issue.

helpful_reviews.title: Missing feature
helpful_reviews.author: CBRAli
helpful_reviews.content: I like using app on my Apple Watch but  the only thing keeping me from giving a higher rating is that I wish there was a simple stop watch built into the app for track workouts. Or the latest fun, it pretends to record an entire ride and then claims the phone is unreachable and refuses to sync it. This is of course nonsense because the watch needed the phoneâ€™s GPS to begin with.  Dear Strava: please go back to making the watch a companion to the phone app instead of a completely broken alternative to it.

helpful_reviews.title: Love it, just one thing...
helpful_reviews.author: Annabelle60202
helpful_reviews.content: I really enjoy Strava. My only issue is several times, and this is the fault of touch screen tech, not the app, something will happen and the app wonâ€™t start after I hit start and store my Phone in my running belt (ie, in between hitting â€œstart runâ€� and putting my phone away, â€œstopâ€� will get pushed and my run doesnâ€™t get tracked). I wish there were an auto sensor or something so if I have Strava open, and am actively moving, it can log the run regardless.

helpful_reviews.title: Apple Watch app is awful
helpful_reviews.author: bmathers
helpful_reviews.content: Terribly problematic watch app. Audio cues work one day, then it stops working the next. Records data on several runs, then â€œno movement detectedâ€� and canâ€™t save your run. When it eventually saves it, there is tons of missing data - all you get is distance and average pace. helpful_reviews.title: Not very useful

Unfortunately, not only has it failed to successfully track my activities, but it also doesnâ€™t show how many calories were burned. My husband uses this app the same way I do, but his seems to work. Iâ€™m very disappointed, itâ€™s inconsistent, I canâ€™t control what stats I want to see, itâ€™s not as user friendly as some other apps Iâ€™ve used, and Iâ€™ve reached out to the company to try and get more information on possibly resolving these issues and have gotten nothing in return. Not worth it. Will be deleting and returning to my previous fitness app.

helpful_reviews.title: Okay running app, probably better for cycling.

helpful_reviews.content: ****This review is for APP only**** ***I did not attempt to use website*** **This is for free version I did not upgrade** I got this app because of a virtual race I'm running soon, but donâ€™t think itâ€™s going to be my go to app for running.  Pros.  1. Good community  2. Used for many virtual races  Cons. 1. 1 decimal place 2. Cant switch to kilometers  3. Phone and watch run separately 4. Very limited info on screen 5. helpful_reviews.title: Great app, BUT...

helpful_reviews.title: Great app

helpful_reviews.title: Mostly okay

helpful_reviews.title: Strava

There is a â€œsyncâ€� and â€œdeleteâ€� button and after two attempts to sync my workout manually from the watch, my workout disappeared all together and i canâ€™t seem to find a way to get it back. helpful_reviews.title: Premium not worth it
helpful_reviews.author: i r joe
helpful_reviews.content: I used strava for a couple of months before deciding to upgrade to premium and let me tell you it is NOT WORTH IT.  As a free mileage and route tracker, strava performs as well as any other cycling app with the added semi-benefit of a social media style feed which no one really interacts with in a serious way.   Upgrading to premium offers several benefits, none of which are actually that enticing. The main feature is being able to map your heart rate and caloric burn rate against other variables for each ride.   What made me cancel my subscription is how poor the HR tracking actually is. There are huge flat spots and unexplained cliffs (example: going up a hill and strava says my HR is around 100bpm) on my charts consistently. This translates to returning home from a ride with a huge discrepancy in how much work youâ€™ve actually put in vs what strava tells you.  100% not worth the exorbitant subscription price.

This serves zero purpose and makes it difficult to keep up with friends activities.  PLEASE RECONSIDER - Iâ€™ll change my rating back to 5 when you change back to the old ways.

helpful_reviews.title: Way too faulty

helpful_reviews.title: Show some love for real MTB and show descending stats. Also support a shuttle mode

helpful_reviews.title: Bugs... like a mosquito
helpful_reviews.author: Nosleeptillbrooklyn99

helpful_reviews.title: Some minor bugs, otherwise perfect app

helpful_reviews.content: The only issue I have with this is when I post a manual run, the time it appears tends to be off hence when you look at your training long it can post your Saturday evening run that actually look place at 7pm on Sunday at 2am for example. helpful_reviews.title: Donâ€™t buy the extras

helpful_reviews.content: You canâ€™t use most of the options on the app itself. You have to use a computer to use most of the â€œbenefitsâ€� Sure, you can program routes but when you do... thereâ€™s No voice guidance along the route you chose, so why bother? helpful_reviews.title: Lot of room for improvement
helpful_reviews.author: The_Griz
helpful_reviews.content: Switched from Nike+ because Strava start/pause/resume/finish is more consistent and reliable on Apple Watch. Upload is poor - it usually takes 10hours or more to see my run on the app. Weather - why doesnâ€™t the app show weather for the run? Best x - Nike+ had a page with best 1m, 10k and so on, that would be nice. Awards - Nike+ had awards for days and months, that would be nice. Active Calories - I just donâ€™t let the app write this data any more as it is so far off from what Apple calculates.

helpful_reviews.title: Good for what it offers!
helpful_reviews.author: brykate
helpful_reviews.content: Really good for my bike rides and running!!  I enjoy seeing my progress through the season and being able to compare to previous season!! helpful_reviews.title: No major complaints

helpful_reviews.title: Useless Apple Watch App
helpful_reviews.author: TricDoc
helpful_reviews.content: I have now lost several workouts now trying to use the awful Apple Watch app. I was looking forward to using my Apple Watch instead of my Garmin 920xt for spin classes but the app screws up the sync every time. Today I did back to back classes for over an hour and a half and after syncing, my Strava app said that I did a ride for zero time and all my heart rate data was lost. This has happened multiple times now. Don’t bother releasing an app if it’s going to make me lose all my data. And now when I try to sync, it just says “uploaded with errors” and I get no data. Useless.

helpful_reviews.title: Fix outdoor walk

helpful_reviews.content: Overall the app is great for tracking my outdoor runs BUT why is the outdoor walk so limited? With the run I get pacing/splits, heart rate, etc but if you walk you get nothing. Makes no sense. The app should be able to track similar data points regardless if I am walking or running. I will at times walk 5 to 10 miles and it would great to see pace, splits, heart rate and compare to other walks. Seems like a simple fix.

helpful_reviews.title: Come in Strava NYRR Runners seems on you
helpful_reviews.author: Silenthearer
helpful_reviews.content: I only use Strava because it’s linked as the official app for NYRR Virtual races. But it’s buggy at best and GPS signal leaves a lot to be desired. Thankfully a friend introduced me to Runkeeper and that’s what I’ve been using along with Strava and I have no issues with it.  Hopefully Strava updates will fix this issue as lots of runners are out and about and need their runs recorded.

helpful_reviews.title: Mostly good
helpful_reviews.author: Garry Stevens
helpful_reviews.content: The app works, 90% of the tone. There's a serious issue with the push notifications and alerts generally, in that in you clock through the push notification, the app opens directly to the comment or activity, but doesn't clear the notification. You've gotta navigate back out and clock on the in-app alert icon. Just a poor programming issue for an established product to have.

helpful_reviews.title: Stinks with Apple Watch 1s
helpful_reviews.author: ElvisMA411
helpful_reviews.content: I have an earlier model Apple Watch and I thought Strava was the answer to my app woes. It isn’t. It’s very hard to start—takes repeated taps. In rain forget it. And when I try to stop recording I find now that it may have paused or may have started a whole new session. So I have a number of workouts recently for 30 mins where I’ve gone 0 miles.
