Finally when biking it chews up a lot of memory so it makes anything on my watch painfully slow.   I can’t afford a new watch anytime soon so my resort is to use the native app.

helpful_reviews.title: Great app for any athlete.
helpful_reviews.author: Pirate Lighting
helpful_reviews.content: I’ve used Strava for a few years both cycling and running.  It’s syncs perfectly with Garmin Connect.   The last two years I’ve used it mostly for running and I have really enjoyed all the segments on the routes I run.   I used it a while back to train for a marathon and it was great.  Now I’m training for a 50K.  Can y’all add a training schedule for different length Ultra’s?

helpful_reviews.title: So close
helpful_reviews.author: Dlux25
helpful_reviews.content: I’ve been a user for about a decade and lately I’ve really come to enjoy the fitness/freshness tracker. But now that summer is coming and I want to swim in addition to run and bike, the tracker becomes completely useless since it doesn’t have a way to log heart rate while swimming. The Apple Watch fitness tracker is great for swimming. Why can Strava use that data? If it could replicate the data or download the data I would give it 5 stars.

helpful_reviews.title: Good app but don’t listen to user requests
helpful_reviews.author: Shaneo111
helpful_reviews.content: I have been using Strava for around 6 years, was premium for 2 but cancelled because I wasn’t getting the value in paying anymore.  One of the biggest things me and thousands of other people have asked for is the ability to switch to chronological view but they keep trying to add new features instead of listening to what people want.  Good app but the developers should pay attention to what people are asking for.

helpful_reviews.title: Great App
helpful_reviews.author: fbolt2000
helpful_reviews.content: Most all the folks I ride with use Strava. It’s nice to be able to see how you’re doing compared to other riders, especially those you follow. But a recent update has taken that last feature out, it appears. If I look at a segment I just completed, I used to be able to instantly compare my time to those I follow. No longer. Maybe it got moved.

helpful_reviews.title: Strava is easy to use and fun.
helpful_reviews.author: Cessna 206T
helpful_reviews.content: Strava is easy to use, it makes it fun to look back on what I have accomplished. It helps me to see how my current fitness compares to previous years. I paid for the upgrade and didn’t use it much, but consider it a worthy donation. I put my phone on airplane mode when I’m riding, to preserve battery. The GPS does a great job of tracking my ride.

helpful_reviews.title: Great App! Could be a little better
helpful_reviews.author: thenofxlagwagon
helpful_reviews.content: The app works great. It’d be cool if some of the website features were transferred to the app like the ability to view laps and GAP pace. Also, as many people have said, it’d be great to be able to use the calendar to plan future workouts. Other than that, I like the app but love the website... only wish they merged a little better.

helpful_reviews.title: Love it - minor notification bubble error
helpful_reviews.author: Dbarton302
helpful_reviews.content: Been using this for a year after having used Nike+ forever and Map My Run a bit. This blows both of those away.  I've just been having the rest notification icon show two more notifications than what's actually there. It's a bit shitting but I'm sure it will get fixed.

helpful_reviews.title: Take photo straight from app!
helpful_reviews.author: Samuel714562
helpful_reviews.content: Just started seriously using the app about a month ago and the main feature I would love to see is the ability to take a photo straight from the app once you are uploading your workout.   It’s a bit of an archaic, total first world problem to go through editing your progress, open the camera, snap the shot, go back to the app, and upload it.

helpful_reviews.title: I do not understand the love for this
helpful_reviews.author: ColoradoPhotog
helpful_reviews.content: As the title says I do not understand the love for this crap, sorry “app”. Over the years I have used MapMyFitness and Wahoo Fitness and they both blow this out of the water. That said they both have their issues, specifically Wahoo won’t let me use an Apple Watch has a heart rate monitor. This is a real shame because Wahoo is the only app I have used that calculates calories by factoring your heart rate. Speaking of calories Strava doesn’t even display calorie burn! I can only assume that the people who truly loves Strava are people who haven’t used anything else, or are merely in it for the social aspect.

helpful_reviews.title: Watch app needs work
helpful_reviews.author: dugan22307
helpful_reviews.content: I am a Strava Premium member and use it to track my cycling data. I was glad to ditch the heart rate strap and track my heart rate on my watch face. Problem is that once you get to 110+ beats per minute the display doesn’t show your heart rate.  It will show 1...❤️.  I have a full size Apple Watch, so that’s not the problem.  Seems like it would be an easy fix; also seems like any Strava engineer that actually used an apple watch would be aggravated by this as well.

helpful_reviews.title: Thanks for the release notes!
helpful_reviews.author: xnsxns
helpful_reviews.content: Just got motivated to do a review because you guys finally put out a release note on a minor release. Uninformative notes on minor releases is a pet peeve of mine, and I’m hoping this is a trend.   All and all a great app and site, still the center of my running tracking.   Need to support power meters for running (like Stryd) to stay up with the times though.

helpful_reviews.title: Overrides Apple Watch workouts
helpful_reviews.author: Peyton Blume
helpful_reviews.content: I have an Apple Watch that I run the workouts on. When I start the workout on both devices it works just fine. When I’m done though, strava will automatically override the Apple workout, and is Inaccurate in the amount of calories I burn, heart rate, etc. when I go to delete the workout from strava the results go back to normal, syncing from the Apple workout. When I launch the app again though (the strava app) in reinstalls the workouts, rendering my stats inaccurate... again. It’s overall just a very frustrating app, and will be going to something else.

helpful_reviews.title: Spam
helpful_reviews.author: Wenzo:)
helpful_reviews.content: Haven’t really got to use the app yet (due to sickness), but days after I had the app downloaded, I was followed by someone promoting some adult junk. This is a silly thing, but I was wondering if there can be a “report” button? This person promoting sex hasn’t run at all, but is just promoting. I’m curious as to how the heck they even added me. Didn’t expect to deal with this on the app :/

helpful_reviews.title: User control
helpful_reviews.author: Mikeh1002
helpful_reviews.content: Sometimes I’ll finish a run and my watch will show the correct data. After uploading to the app either the time changes or distance changes and it messes everything up. One change had my first mile at 4:05 and it should have been more like 7:30. My watch told me the right time during the run. Allow the user to manually go in and change the time and distance if the gps or software can’t get it right.

helpful_reviews.title: Confused
helpful_reviews.author: kolbyanderson
helpful_reviews.content: Just ran my first run with strava, loved it while I was running. It called out my times while I was running, and I ended up running 6 miles in around 48 minutes. However when I closed the app and opened a few minutes later, it said that I ran 6 miles in 43 minutes and it showed my splits and average mile time being much different than they were before. Why’d this happen?

helpful_reviews.title: Overall good. Some suggestions.
helpful_reviews.author: az342
helpful_reviews.content: Performance is an issue. There are lag times I can observe easily.   The biggest enhancement request would be to support workouts for runs. Being able to program 12x400 with 2 min jog in between. Or alerts for heart rate zone would be great.   Otherwise I enjoy that I don't have to use my phone on my runs. The reason I got an Apple Watch was so I could use Strava with GPS.  10/3 update: With the update to watchOS 4 the Watch app is slower than ever on a series 2 Watch. Had a crash that caused me to lose all my data mid run. The screens are very lagging and often unresponsive to taps/swipes. I can tell it’s laggy since when I hit start to when it finally goes to the timer screen not uncommon for the time counter to be already at 5-8 seconds. That’s a lot of slowness.

helpful_reviews.title: Super motivating for running/biking
helpful_reviews.author: crh7
helpful_reviews.content: Strava has changed the game for me completely in running. It’s been so helpful in training for short races, improving my times, encouraging friends with kudos, and keeping some competitive spirit. Functionality could use some improvements - e.g., ability to add videos instead of just still photos, ability to see heart rate data from Fitbit with the free app version, etc.

helpful_reviews.title: Mostly great but bugs w 3D press recording!
helpful_reviews.author: fuqnugget
helpful_reviews.content: Lately I’ve been finding super annoying issues w activities that seemingly don’t record until partway through the ride.  Meaning lot of lost mileage and partial tracks.    Turns out it seems to be if you use the 3D aka hard press menu to start an activity.  Which is a cool feature but consistently when I just use that, I’ll find the start of my ride doesn’t record datapoints and the track only begins to record after the next time I pull the phone out and unlock it and view the app itself.     This is a really annoying bug as I lost several rides (or at least the parts until my first break where I checked the app for mileage only to discover it hadn’t been recording).   Bottom line don’t use 3D press menu until they fix it! Regular app use seems to work fine still, AFAICT.

helpful_reviews.title: Add this
helpful_reviews.author: Haiavshzzx
helpful_reviews.content: I love using this app I run everyday and all my friends have this. I like how it tracks weekly miles and it’s cool to see other peoples races and workouts on here. I wish it just had more decimals for the timing. How hard could it be to add a hundredths place for time and mileage I’m constantly getting like 3.99 miles and it counts it as 3.9 erasing almost .1 miles off my total

helpful_reviews.title: I want the old voice back!
helpful_reviews.author: Lmr80
helpful_reviews.content: I’ve enjoyed using Strava for running and biking, and like the running clubs. However, I must have updated because there is a now a new male voice that is horrible! I can barely hear it and definitely can’t make out what he’s saying with music on low volume. What’s the point of announcing your splits if it’s muffled and way too low? How do I get the old voice back?! Five stars for a free app if this is fixed, otherwise I’ll go back to Nike.

helpful_reviews.title: Strava has let me down on many runs
helpful_reviews.author: shyamiyer
helpful_reviews.content: It's been more than once I've found the app to have not tracked my run and the statistics are just not reliable! I use my iPhone to track my runs and do not use any run tracking devices. But I've tried all the ways suggested by Strava Support to troubleshoot my phone's GPS and the app just doesn't pick up my position. (I haven't noticed such consistent location errors so far on GMaps) The frustration at the end of your run, hoping that you'll track your statistics and progress and then you see - 0.5mi run in 38mins! Not a reliable app!!

helpful_reviews.title: Great app, have been recommending since 2012
helpful_reviews.author: Pandabear723
helpful_reviews.content: App is great for stats regardless of what I’m doing and ever since Apple Watch integration came out I’ve been more than happy with it. I hope in the future a feature will be added to set a pace while running so that if I deviate too much my phone or watch will notify me and I can adjust, just a thought!

helpful_reviews.title: Always resets notification settings.
helpful_reviews.author: Lenoxbm
helpful_reviews.content: Strava is a great app for monitoring running - however I’m getting pretty sick of the app automatically resetting my notification settings every time a new version is released. Was set for just a few actions to cause a notification, it updated a few days ago - and sure enough - my settings in the app has EVERY single notification turned on.  I will stop recommending to others to download for this reason.

helpful_reviews.title: Unreliable data, Very inconsistent
helpful_reviews.content: I downloaded this app to track my progress as I get back into consistent running:hiking etc. the set up and features seem ideal for basic needs. Unfortunately I can’t count on the app to accurately track my miles. Invariably I finish my run only to see that the app accounted for less than half of my distance. Of course, this affects pace, etc. this happens whether I have weak or strong GPS signal. Very annoying. I like the features, just wish the data were accurate.

helpful_reviews.title: Version 58.0.0 broke distance/speed
helpful_reviews.author: velo.junkie
helpful_reviews.content: I have been a Strava user for over five years and always found it reliable and an excellent way to track my rides and runs. Three days ago I updated to version 58.0.0 and now Strava no longer tracks distance and speed correctly - only time. This happens with both rides and runs. I’ve looked online and tried turning off WiFi, closing apps, turning location on/off, but no change. This is an issue Strava engineers are aware of but have no idea how to fix. Bummer. Guess it’s time to move onto something else.

helpful_reviews.title: Errrmeerrgeeerd
helpful_reviews.author: Wreks
helpful_reviews.content: So I have used this app before with no problems.   I recently started using it again and have run into some weird issues. Every time I start the app through my drop down screen it won’t log the bike ride.   I can hear the voice throughout my ride (stop, resume) that kind of stuff and I can see it logging my miles but when I stop to save the ride it doesn’t save it kicks me out to the normal screen.... very annoying

helpful_reviews.title: Apple Watch app
helpful_reviews.author: future DirecTV customer
helpful_reviews.content: This review is for the Apple Watch app, the phone app is great. I do not use the Apple Watch app because it uses the Apple Watch heart rate monitor which is not accurate. I use a Bluetooth chest strap with the phone app that works very well.  I understand Strava wanting a stand-alone app, but it also needs a mode where it only serves as a user interface for the phone app.  Showing activity time, speed, distance, heart rate, current segment by name, +/- personal best time.  Then I would use the watch app.  Please provide this feature!

helpful_reviews.title: Location Suggestion
helpful_reviews.author: SteelIsReal
helpful_reviews.content: It would be helpful to have the athletes home base location also be listed by their name IN THE FEED, just as its an avail option on their profile page. In addition, it would be super helpful for a location of the session being viewed/reviewed by others without having to tap the map then pan out to figure out where on the planet it took place. Thx!

helpful_reviews.title: Request to add feature service notification
helpful_reviews.author: 4mss4
helpful_reviews.content: I wish if there was a way to track the maintenance of the bike. If I could just get a notification of when my bike is due for service based on hours or miles ridden. Otherwise I have to remember manually.  This would be very helpful for mtb where shocks are serviced based on hours ridden on bike.

helpful_reviews.title: Latest update removes features
helpful_reviews.author: Quattrocup
helpful_reviews.content: I paid for the training membership, and now with the latest update there is so much less data. I can’t even see an exact time for my last run, only the rounded time. The pace graph is hard to read and there are no units of measurement so I can’t even tell you what my pace was at certain times. Please fix and add back all the features and data that were there previously and I will update my review and rating. Until then I’ll use another app. I may seek a refund since the features I paid for are now missing.

helpful_reviews.title: The best all around activity tracking app out there!
helpful_reviews.author: EricklickyT
helpful_reviews.content: I use my Strava app for everything from kayaking to how far I walk  around the grocery store and most importantly my ride data. My use of Strava has allowed me to visualize my efforts and see my data in a way that helps me get better and understand my body/effort and how to improve.

helpful_reviews.title: Best app for recoding all your activities
helpful_reviews.author: J Zuend
helpful_reviews.content: I have by now logged thousands of miles biking, running, and hiking. The app is very simple to use yet gives you tons of information if you add heart rate monitoring or your cycle power meter.  I love the ability to add photos and competition for KOM’s. There is no other app out there that is so comprehensive and yet so simple to use.

helpful_reviews.title: Needs better graphs and a chronological feed
helpful_reviews.author: WITstudent
helpful_reviews.content: Graphs: When analyzing an effort, such as a PR, the graphs are interactive, wonderful. These same graphs should be enabled for viewing stats for any workout. You can keep the graphs on separate pages like you do now when viewing HR, Speed, Elevation graphs for a workout but please make the graphs interactive.  More data: Some data is missing from the app that is available online. At least give us our training load and intensity like you do on the website. Stretch goal: Fitness and freshness graph.  Feed: The “algorithmic” feed is very annoying. I looked at your support articles, I gave my feedback by taking the survey that you have linked. I am also reiterating the fact here that I want the option to view the feed chronologically!

helpful_reviews.title: Really awesomely GREAT!!! but just pricey..
helpful_reviews.author: youtube.com/JackeyZeng
helpful_reviews.content: This app without being premium is pretty good, actually it’s really amazing. Almost anything I pretty much want to know, will be known. However if you want more stats, you have to pay a $7-$8 fee which is kind of expensive at some point for an app. Then again I don’t like any other app, so I will continue using this one until something else pops up.

helpful_reviews.title: Nice but Premium does not work well with Apple Watch integration
helpful_reviews.author: JDlc
helpful_reviews.content: All around this is a good app, and you get drawn in to subscribe to premium, but it is a big let down when you learn you can use Apple Watch OR iPhone.  You get a heart rate with the watch but the display is unusable when you are riding.  In the other hand, with an iPhone and a phone mount on your bike you can see your speed, race your prior rides, but without the ability to monitor heart rate.

helpful_reviews.title: Good app but annoying bug with Apple Watch
helpful_reviews.author: musicmachine2008
helpful_reviews.content: When I complete a run using my Apple Watch series 3, it’ll say no motion was detected despite having tracked distance, speed etc during the run. The workaround I’ve found that works is to put my phone in airplane mode before I leave for the run (I don’t take my phone on the run). I’ve concluded there is a handoff bug between the watch and the phone.

helpful_reviews.title: Good but...
helpful_reviews.author: Br£n[}@n
helpful_reviews.content: I love strava, but is there anyway you could get with your buddy Zwift and allow people to use only their phone to get Zwifty. I hate how I would either have buy an expensive speedometer or an expensive roller. Please consider making something where you can track cadence and speed but still use your phone.

helpful_reviews.title: Great for the Anyone Into Fitness
helpful_reviews.author: ADAMRCMTB
helpful_reviews.content: This is a great app which does everything you want too, especially with premium. My only 2 complaints are that #1, the app freezes my IPhone 6s sometimes which is really annoying, and #2 you can’t see your cadence on the app only on the computer. Besides those, this is a great app for everyone and is wonderful for connecting with other athletes.

helpful_reviews.title: Needs enhancements
helpful_reviews.author: RichfromNaples
helpful_reviews.content: I have been cycling for a long time and I was using Strava as a record but then I noticed that my average speed was declining even though my bike computer said different.  I downloaded another GPS bike program and it recorded my average speed up to 3 mph higher. Since Strava has removed the “don’t record at speeds below” option it isn’t accurate especially if you get off your bike and walk to take pictures like I do.

helpful_reviews.title: If it wasn’t on Strava ...
helpful_reviews.author: Highlander664
helpful_reviews.content: I try to log every ride on Strava and really appreciate the data. I ride alone a lot so I need some kind of motivation to keep improving.    There are a couple of things that irk me.  1. The iPhone app doesn’t sort PRs in order like the website does.  The app keeps things in chronological order.    2. Can’t reply to comments.  It would be nice to be able to reply directly to a comment to maintain some context to the conversation.   3. It would be nice to set alert indicators for certain thresholds.  For example, if my heart rate goes over 185bpm, flash an alert.  Or if I pass a certain distance .  It’s similar to the live segments concept where an alert pops up notifying you of a favorite segment.

helpful_reviews.title: Lot to like, lot to annoy the crap out of me
helpful_reviews.author: BuzzBangZing
helpful_reviews.content: I’m fine with freemium apps, if the app actually works.  I’m an IT guy, so if I can’t figure out how to make something work, Strava you have a big problem. Whatever “Offering Management” team you hired needs to stop *icking around and get back to basics.  Can’t for the life of me get Apple Watch 4 to sync heart rate data. Works fine with my Jabra Sport BT headphones for heart rate. Honestly, I switched to the Jabra app since it reports to Strava, and everything actually works. Strava problem solved by using another app, go figure.  Doubles mileage to Apple Activity. Yah annoying. Useless for reporting.  Doesn’t report calorie, Active, correctly.  No way in hell my 40 minute high intensity 10 mile mountain bike trail ride burned 200 calories.   Voice over prompts do not work while listening to Apple Music when cycling.

helpful_reviews.title: Overall no complaints
helpful_reviews.author: Hffhidds
helpful_reviews.content: Been using Strava for a few years now and just upgraded to Premium / Pro / Summit is whatever it’s called.  Seems like every time I think “I wish Strava could / would do X”, it turns out as an added feature in a short while.  Love the Strava Labs feature.  Just keep doing what you’re doing!

helpful_reviews.title: Been using it for years.
helpful_reviews.author: Elbowman1
helpful_reviews.content: It’s easy to use and it’s a great way to keep track of your training as well as being able to see your own incremental improvement on the leaderboards. I love the motivation it gives me to get out and ride when I see friends posting rides and getting faster!

helpful_reviews.title: Decimal places
helpful_reviews.author: Manyy191
helpful_reviews.content: Ok so strava is a very solid running app overall and I couldnâ€™t recommend anything over it. A major problem, however is that on Apple Watch distance is only displayed to one decimal place. Although the more accurate distance can be seen after the run, runners like STATS. Itâ€™d be very useful to see this kind of specific statistics displayed on Apple Watch during the run.

helpful_reviews.title: What a terrible app
helpful_reviews.author: Zillifam
helpful_reviews.content: This is bar far the worst running app Iâ€™ve ever used. Which is sad because Iâ€™m a huge Strava fan. The only reason I used the app was because my Garmin was dead. I feel the Apple Watch is mostly at fault, but man. 1) Ran tonight. App tells me Iâ€™ve hit my 5 mile mark. I slide over the screen to get to the pause/end run page. Hit end. App tells me it didnâ€™t detect any movement and canâ€™t record. Ummm.... You just tracked my 5 mile run. What gives Strava? This is a terrible interface, terrible info layout, hard to use app. Iâ€™ll be using my garmin from now on. What a waste.

helpful_reviews.title: Current Pace??
helpful_reviews.author: mtor410
helpful_reviews.content: I really love this app! I totally converted from NikeRun Club app and even went through the tedious process of moving my previous runs. I only did the last year, but will eventually move over the last 10+ years of runs!   Iâ€™ll upgrade to 5 stars when it can display the current pace.

helpful_reviews.title: Great app for Apple Watch
helpful_reviews.author: MamaQz
helpful_reviews.content: I use this to track my training runs and cross training on my bike.  I really like how it automatically compares runs and run segments.  What I really wish for though is for a haptic/vibration at each mile. The audio cue is too loud (and drawn out), but unless you happen to look at your watch at the mike mark you could miss it.  I really really hope they can add this small feature!!

helpful_reviews.title: Great app but...
helpful_reviews.author: GCJ17
helpful_reviews.content: Overall I love this app & use it 6 days per week. Two things that I would recommend, first make it possible to add new shoes from the app. Second, remove or change peoples activity when it is obviously incorrect, it messes up the segment leaders. When I see someone has ran 33 miles at a 3 minute pace itâ€™s safe to assume they forgot to switch the app from â€œrunâ€� to â€œrideâ€�.

helpful_reviews.title: No surf option on Apple Watch
helpful_reviews.author: ChickenJoe_
helpful_reviews.content: I downloaded this app to use it for surfing with my Apple Watch series 3. The app on the iPhone has a surf workout option but the watch does not. Makes no sense considering no one in their right mind would surf with their phone. Tried to google it Incase I was missing something but didnâ€™t find any answers. I rarely write reviews but I want the developer to know that if this app has a surf option for the Apple Watch that worked well, Iâ€™m sure it would be a 5-star app for me.

helpful_reviews.title: Apple Watch uploads hang
helpful_reviews.author: haveahennessy
helpful_reviews.content: Guys, I know the Apple Watch APIs arenâ€™t the best. I know writing tests is a pain. I know that QA takes the backseat to feature development. But please, please test - and fix - your Watch app. I see a lot of people on Strava support complaining about Watch uploads just hanging and then being told that thereâ€™s a problem with their data connection. And now Iâ€™m having this issue too. This seems to have been going on since March. These are your customers that youâ€™re leaving hanging for months! Pls fix.

helpful_reviews.title: Excellent. The way social media should function.
helpful_reviews.author: LARS2LARS
helpful_reviews.content: No adds and less incentive for developers to draw users in with endless meaningless clicks and waste-of-time scrolling. Just friends logging miles and encouragement from fellow athletes. Excellent app that functions seamlessly with my Garmin Fenix 5. I recommend this app to anyone with any sort of GPS device who exercises.

helpful_reviews.title: The new detail layout
helpful_reviews.author: ivanlesko
helpful_reviews.content: I miss being able to quickly scroll through ride analysis and segments when the detail page loaded.  Iâ€™m not a fan of adding two extra steps to have to look at power analysis and segment results... too many network requests and page segues.  Update 10/8: the PR and KOM detail on the map for the activity thumbnails are a really nice touch!!

helpful_reviews.title: Needs One Simple Feature
helpful_reviews.author: Futuregrace
helpful_reviews.content: Great App, works great with Apple Watch, the social feature is very motivating, just wish I could find how many miles Iâ€™ve run in a particular month. Iâ€™m shocked this info isnâ€™t available on app or the web interface, even with full subscription. Friends ask, how many miles you run in June? and I tell them I have no idea because I use Strava.

helpful_reviews.title: Nice but needs work
helpful_reviews.author: beegeeeer
helpful_reviews.content: Have been cycling with paid (premium) Strava over a year here are what needs improvement.  1.  Generation of Beacon Texts.  Overall way too slow and often have wait before I can start my ride as it just hangs and have to restart the app. Especially inconvenient when riding in winter and have to take gloves off to deal with this.   2.  Would prefer an easy way to save and select different beacon text groups.  So I can quickly get going and have a minimum amount of time to get notifications out.  3.  Would like some privacy options that track and log your entire route but when sharing to the larger outside world (not friends and family) omit the first and last parts of the route for privacy.

helpful_reviews.title: Bug Recording Movement on Apple Watch
helpful_reviews.author: KW Run
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve used the Strava app with my Apple Watch for more than a year now. It had usually worked well, but recently I started having a problem. Iâ€™ll go for a runâ€”six miles this morningâ€”and when I go to Finish the run in the app, it tells me no movement was recorded. If I cancel, I see in the app itself that Iâ€™ve gone 6 miles. So it recorded something. Seems like a pretty obvious bug. This appears to me to pop up mostly right after Strava updates the app. Regardless, itâ€™s making me consider going back to Garmin.

helpful_reviews.title: Apple Watch app refuses to sync
helpful_reviews.author: Comfy sweats
helpful_reviews.content: I have Strava on my iPhone and Apple watch. The watch app is glitchy (auto-pause doesnâ€™t disengage at the start of my run) and for the past week (before the most recent update and after) refuses to automatically sync to my phone. The â€œSyncâ€� button in Run History is useless. Strava Support hasnâ€™t been much help in fixing this. I had no trouble before the most recent updates. Generally I love Strava, but this lack of connectivity is really starting to bother me. Without GPS data, none of the features in Strava are accessible

helpful_reviews.title: Strava is dependable & easy to use
helpful_reviews.author: Maryjoego
helpful_reviews.content: I like that I can count on Strava to record each of my walks & bike rides. It has never let me down & I use it 6-7 days per week. It is also simple to use. I wanted to check out the premium app. but canâ€™t find it in app. store. It seems like I should support people who design such useful apps. Thanks.

helpful_reviews.title: Watch App needs updates
helpful_reviews.author: tvieso
helpful_reviews.content: Only speaking about the watch app here.   Audio Cues What happened? Did you pull this? Because it does not work at all anymore. I really enjoyed this feature.   Music Integration It's often a nuisance to fully switch apps just to turn music down or pause it. It would be really nice to have it integrated with the Strava app (like it is on Apple workouts) where it just a swipe away.   Realtime Breadcrumb Mapping This would be a game changer. Please integrate this for people without cellar (if possible).   Â·Â·Â·  For those complaining about not starting and stopping without significant motion, just swing your arm hard and it detects motion immediately. Basically just give it a jump start and you're good. That's literally all it takes. Never failed me.

helpful_reviews.title: Solid app. More Apple Watch developments needed
helpful_reviews.author: Nashman30
helpful_reviews.content: I really like the app. Solid performance. Areas of opportunity would be with the Apple Watch companion app. Number one thing Iâ€™d like to see is segment notification. Notice when Iâ€™m coming up on one and then how Iâ€™m doing compared to my previous PR. This is available on Garmin watches. Would be awesome to see it on Apple Watch. This for me would push it to 5 stars.

helpful_reviews.title: Suddenly isnâ€™t recording distance
helpful_reviews.author: AndroidMcD
helpful_reviews.content: I have pretty religiously used Strava for the last few years. Iâ€™m pretty simple when it comes to run appsâ€”just chart my time, pace and distance. Over the last few weeks it canâ€™t even do that. Iâ€™ll hit record, the time will go but distance and pace stand still. Just downloaded this last update, maybe Iâ€™ll try it again, but Iâ€™m def looking for other apps to replace it.

helpful_reviews.title: Doesnâ€™t properly record activity.
helpful_reviews.author: JermZz
helpful_reviews.content: Recently, the Strava app has not been able to properly record my bike rides. At one point, it wouldnâ€™t record them at all, despite it successfully acquiring a GPS signal and it showing that it was recording at the outset; stopping periodically throughout the ride, I would fine it had stopped soon after I took after and not have recorded a thing. Updated my phoneâ€™s software and now it records a portion of my ride, but misses probably 30-40% of it. Bummer that I canâ€™t track my activity anymore.

helpful_reviews.title: No Avg Speed in Workout Feed
helpful_reviews.author: Mito Cringo
helpful_reviews.content: Strava works fairly well overall, but why in the world is the average speed of a workout not displayed in the feed view?? The design has so much open space to incorporate it, but instead I have to click on a workout and swipe right twice to see it. Average speed should be visible in the workout feed and on the first display of a workout when you click through to it.

helpful_reviews.title: Time is not accurate
helpful_reviews.author: Sgrant102
helpful_reviews.content: Whenever they update the app it really messes up the apps ability to keep accurate splits while running. I use strava on my I watch and Nike on my phone but now I cannot have both running at the same time. It is very disappointing because strava was good while it works but I have accumulated a bit nag of miles on Nike and I am not willing to give them up. Hopefully they fix the problem but I cannot count on strava while running if I want to see my splits.

helpful_reviews.title: Indoor Run Tracking...the feature we had been waiting for!
helpful_reviews.author: JROG7
helpful_reviews.content: Thank you for adding indoor run tracking with the Apple watch. This was a much needed feature for winter training or for those treadmill runs in a hotel.   Strava is awesome!  One tiny thing...is it possible to track HR on the phone during a ride via Apple Watch?

helpful_reviews.title: Run Power!
helpful_reviews.author: An obsessive runner
helpful_reviews.content: Strava is great and a fun way to connect and compete with friends. With running power meters becoming more common, Iâ€™d love to see better integration in Strava. Please include this soon! Comparing HR, GAP, and Power data would be extremely helpful to training. Additionally, I would love to see a function where Strava can predict FTP for runners based on the data above! More features and analysis for premium accounts are needed!

helpful_reviews.title: Still fails to get heart data
helpful_reviews.author: frustrated strava user
helpful_reviews.content: After multiple updates and reinstalls, the app still fails getting heart rate data on my Apple Watch 2. App is otherwise pretty cool, but this is major functionality that doesn't work still months after release.  Update: now with iOS 11, the watch app doesnâ€™t work at all. Was crashing every time I opened it. I reinstalled and itâ€™s stuck on saying â€œon your phone, sign up or log inâ€�. Duh. I have. Iâ€™ve reinstalled again. Itâ€™s showing notifications on the watch, but I canâ€™t record. Ridiculous.

helpful_reviews.title: I use it. I like. But...
helpful_reviews.author: Miiiiikkeee53678
helpful_reviews.content: Great app. I love it. Many year user. But 3 stars because all too many times now the location data on my city runs has been a terrible zig zag. I mean come on, I can't run through buildings and I can't run a 1.4 minute mile. Let's use location data we know about Streets ( google API etc) to cleanup the raw path data . I believe in you you can do it!   I'm sure your engineers are dying to solve a problem as cool and fun as this.

helpful_reviews.title: I love this, but one suggestion.
helpful_reviews.author: Tigbench
helpful_reviews.content: I use this for cycling and dog walking a lot, and I love it for that, but I do have a suggestion. I would also like to use this for tracking time spent on self defense through manual entries. Could you create a category for that please? Maybe it could be measured through time spent. I could include the description like one would do for anything else.   Thank you, John L.

helpful_reviews.title: Add to Weekly Totals
helpful_reviews.author: Gphilly35
helpful_reviews.content: Currently Strava does not add workouts like Strength Training to the mobile weekly totals. It only has bike, run and swim. Please include the other activities in the â€œtimeâ€� weekly totals so users can see a true hours worked out each week. Perhaps add another label like â€œotherâ€� for a quick reference of hours spent outside of bike, run and swim.

helpful_reviews.title: Not good for Apple Watch users
helpful_reviews.author: gg5557890
helpful_reviews.content: If you want to use Strava with your Apple Watch, they force you to use their App which is terrible.  Lacks functionality and the layout is confusing. I would prefer to use the built in Apple Watch running app but Strava has not, or refuses to, build in the ability to read run data from the health app.  For some reason they want you to use their app.  So Apple Watch users are forced to use a third party app to sync the Apple data to, then sync again to Strava.

helpful_reviews.title: Skewed priorities and poor customer service
helpful_reviews.author: 00Hein
helpful_reviews.content: Strava is trying to turn the list of activities into a Facebook-like feed that optimizes spending you time there; that's too bad because eg the non-chronological ranking and email reminders just create the same kind of desensitization and context collapse as Facebook.   Customer service is poor even for premium members; eg sharing activities by link broke months ago for accounts with enhanced privacy but their representatives don't even understand the issue.

helpful_reviews.title: Slow and unresponsive
helpful_reviews.author: Kth8888
helpful_reviews.content: I used to love this app and used it every time I rode. The latest version, however, has become so painfully slow that I only use it when I really want to now. It takes quite some time to start up, and also is unresponsive for a short time when ending a ride. Not really what I want to spend my time waiting for when Iâ€™m getting on or off my bike. Too bad because I like the app otherwise.

helpful_reviews.title: Not Ready for Apple Watch Series 4 LTE
helpful_reviews.author: AngelDN
helpful_reviews.content: I love Strava but right now, as much as I want it to be, Strava is just is not ready for the Apple Watch series 4.  It seems the App has reverted back to Series 1.  Way too many issues to constantly overlook. Too many workarounds to achieve a working app suggests an app does not work as it should. Looking forward to updating my rating once the numerous issues (elevation, voiceover, features,  etcetera) are fixed and work like it has in the past and recent history.

helpful_reviews.title: I donâ€™t know what I paid for....
helpful_reviews.author: K. O'Brien
helpful_reviews.content: I bought the summit package to get a training plan. Maybe I missed something along the way but getting a plan emailed to me and being promoted to upgrade to get a coach for my workout is too much. I expected to have the verbal cues for tempo runs, paying for an emailed schedule through an app is ridiculous.  Signing in online to set up sneakers and routes is a bad use of an app. This is supposed to be convenient. The route planning wasnâ€™t even available at the time.  I cancelled the subscription and will be deleting the app.

helpful_reviews.title: Watch App Needs Updated
helpful_reviews.author: burmarang
helpful_reviews.content: Would give this app 5 stars if the watch app was fixed. Every time the app updates the watch app tells me the I need to log in on the phone app. This is beyond frustrating when I am able to start a run without my phone. They point of the gps watch it to run without your phone. Please fix so I donâ€™t have to abandon Strava

helpful_reviews.title: Missing Feature
helpful_reviews.author: I_am_Fred
helpful_reviews.content: I've used Strava for about 6 months now and I have noticed a problem: Occasionally, I finish a ride and forget to turn off Strava. It then records all the walking I do until I take out my phone and realize it's still recording. If it is possible to crop activities already, where can I do that? If not, please add this feature!

helpful_reviews.title: Issues with satellite tracking?
helpful_reviews.author: Btbxgirl
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve been using Strava for years and only had some minor blips along the way with tracking. I donâ€™t know if itâ€™s because of the latest updates, but the app cannot seem to pick up my usual routes anymore. My latest run has me cutting through yards and skipping long tracts, resulting in me running 5:00 miles. I wish!

helpful_reviews.title: Triathlon support please!
helpful_reviews.author: bigetan
helpful_reviews.content: The app is great social tool for biking, running, and swimming. However there is zero support for triathletes which boggles my mind considering that ppl have been asking for this for a long time.  One main activity with total tri time which can be drilled down to see the separate sport times. How about triathlon challenges?  Almost impossible hitting sport specific challenges when your training for 3 different ones.

helpful_reviews.title: Iâ€™ve given up on this app
helpful_reviews.author: Pghsm00thhands
helpful_reviews.content: I use this app almost daily and every time any more as it saves my rides everything looks fine till it loads on my profile and itâ€™s never my full ride. For instance today I rode 16 miles on a road bike on a paved trail I want to go finish the ride and save it and it all looked great it pops up on my feed and it was .6 miles I didnâ€™t close the app I didnâ€™t do anything and this has been happening almost every ride I have auto pause off I donâ€™t see why anyone would pay for this app if itâ€™s not even reliable

helpful_reviews.title: Best running app
helpful_reviews.author: Beluga00000001
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve used several apps for running & Strava is by far the best for both the Apple Watch & iphone. Love the ability to create routes, especially in new cities Iâ€™m visiting. Great for post run analyzing.  By far the best feature is beacon. I live in the country, so itâ€™s nice to know someone has my back while Iâ€™m out on my runs.

helpful_reviews.title: Good App
helpful_reviews.author: rosey1963
helpful_reviews.content: I would have given this app 5 stars had you been able to see it on the new Infograph watch face on iOS. With this one exception it does all you could want from the app. I particularly like being able to go on a run and record my route even when I donâ€™t have my phone with me. Keep up the good work but please add it to the infograph iOS watch faces.

helpful_reviews.title: They keep charging me.
helpful_reviews.author: pzychobubbs
helpful_reviews.content: I think I have it finally worked out, but I learned the hard way that even after I thought I had cancelled my subscription, it kept showing back up on my credit card.  Emails would appear on my app but not on my actual email.   You would think they would cancel the subscription themselves, but you have to go through iTunes.    The app itself was really neat but the actual distance was not accurate.  On trail runs it was way off.  Their are free apps that work a lot better.

helpful_reviews.title: Fell in love with it.
helpful_reviews.author: Epaulter
helpful_reviews.content: I resisted using Strava for a long time and finally gave it a go. Some of the metrics are questionable nor am I using the social aspect of it. Tracking and segments shine for me. The segments have changed the way I ride for the better and give me motivation to push harder. I mainly go at it solo so having goals mid ride are a huge plus. I upgraded to premium after 2 weeks. Iâ€™m happy!

helpful_reviews.title: New segment page doesnâ€™t show the current time
helpful_reviews.author: efleming76
helpful_reviews.content: Shows your PR and all the other details, except for the actual time for the current effort.   Also, new segment page doesnâ€™t allow user to â€œStarâ€� a segment.  Aside from that, GPS track has been very accurate and overall performance high.   Four Out of Five Stars on this update

helpful_reviews.title: Better than the others? Yes.
helpful_reviews.author: Bruce the Mormon
helpful_reviews.content: I donâ€™t know exactly what it is about Strava, but it feels so intuitive and actually social.   It does a great job tracking runs and is very well designed to give you the info of what you need while your out.  Plus anytime I go on a 6+ mile run I get kudos... which always feels nice...

helpful_reviews.title: Failed to upload my activity
helpful_reviews.author: CindyCisneros
helpful_reviews.content: I used to really like this app. I use it for running & biking. The best thing about this app is that it continues to record even when the signal is weak or there is no signal. Iâ€™m disappointed with the app however because it wonâ€™t upload my activity. My activity shows as â€œPending Uploadâ€�. Iâ€™ve tried several times to upload, but it never does. I was using this app to measure my progress, but without uploading my activity there is no way to track it now. Disappointed :(

helpful_reviews.title: App is great but a HUGE resource hog
helpful_reviews.author: nrosser
helpful_reviews.content: Ok Strava peeps - you surely know this. The functionality of the app itself is great. No issues. BUT - when using it, even on my brand new iPhone 8, the app seems to soak up all the available CPU resources on the device. Editing an activity, for example, seems to bring the device to its knees. Yes yes I can hear you now - close all other apps, blah blah - I know all that. Bottom line, ya gotta streamline the thing, or do SOME work on the app so it doesnâ€™t hog all the available device resources. Good luck! ğŸ‘�ğŸ�»

helpful_reviews.title: Latest update breaks watch app
helpful_reviews.author: rf1520
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™m a premium member and have been using the watch app for over a year, and have really enjoyed the app. But the latest update broke all syncing. Iâ€™m sick of being pushed around between apps when updates break thingsâ€”I started using Strava when Runkeeper broke the heart rate functionality from the phone, but at least their watch app has it. Please fix it and test things thoroughly before pushing them out in the future. An old app that works is always better than a new broken one.

helpful_reviews.title: Segments?
helpful_reviews.author: TxAdamFitz
helpful_reviews.content: What happened to the segments? We have a ton of paved trails in our area. I used to get comps on my ride through segments. Now I have a â€œno segments foundâ€�. However identical rides found segments.   Please bring it back. Itâ€™s a neat feature and helps me gauge my effort.  Update, I found if I start my ride from my Apple Watch the segments worked. Iâ€™ll see if this is a fix for my issue and respond back. Updating my rating to a 4 for now.

helpful_reviews.title: Good customer service.
helpful_reviews.author: Rachels83
helpful_reviews.content: I had some issues with the app crashing after an update. The customer service rep worked with me to try and resolve it. Eventually the app was patched and began to work again. I did loose data on those activities but over the last year that I have had Strava I have not had many issues with it.

helpful_reviews.title: Does not track mileage accurately
helpful_reviews.author: Jojojapan82
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve been using this app consistently for a few weeks now and am deleting it today. It does not keep accurate track of mileage during running. Some days I will have run 5 minutes and it tells me itâ€™s been a mile, when I know Iâ€™m not that fast, other days I will have run 13 minutes and it tells me itâ€™s been 0.1 miles when I know Iâ€™m not that slow! I wish it worked better, not sure why it doesnâ€™t but Iâ€™m over it not helping me keep track of my miles.

helpful_reviews.title: Great app but needs some de-bugging and upgrades
helpful_reviews.author: Daniel connors
helpful_reviews.content: I use the app every day on my bicycle and love the beacon option for premium users. The photo option crashes every time I open photos to add them. The app needs the ability to add/create routes from the phone and the online version could be more user friendly for route creation. Willing to up my rating with some advancements and debugs in future versions.

helpful_reviews.title: Watch app is totally broken - not able to save runs
helpful_reviews.author: Im Pacific
helpful_reviews.content: Hello,  I have a fully up-to-date Series 3 Watch (OS and app version). Every time I finish an activity after the latest release it says my location has not changed and so it canâ€™t save the activity. This is after running 7+ miles more than once. I know the GPS is working because itâ€™s accurately tracking my pace and distance.  PLEASE PUSH A FIX ASAP! This is a bug that makes the app actually useless lol, I really would like this valuable data to not be lost every run.

helpful_reviews.title: Works well on my iPhone – not on my Apple Watch
helpful_reviews.author: ob2k2
helpful_reviews.content: I have an Apple Watch 4. I’ve been riding the last week in Germany and France. For some reason whenever I enable this Stava app on my Apple Watch it will not shut down when i am done and close the app. I’ve closed it numerous times and the soon as I do it shows up again draining my battery. I thought this might be because the Strava app was turned on my iPhone. Not the case. So for now I have deleted the app from my Apple Watch and just use my iPhone for tracking my routes.

helpful_reviews.title: Drains battery, messes up GPS data
helpful_reviews.author: jonnyd420
helpful_reviews.content: Horrible experience. Watch app is too dumb to pause HR and other sensors while you're not moving, so if you take a lunch break on a ride you come back with 15% battery gone. Also, just did a ride from SF to Marin and it thinks I biked across the bay rather than the bridge...clearly didn't record any gps data or it was so sparse it drew a line between two points.   Awful. Only reason I use this is because my historical data is there. Apple's own outdoor cycle activity tracking is way better.

helpful_reviews.title: Still lacking
helpful_reviews.author: svono12
helpful_reviews.content: I’ve been using Strava (free version) on and off for a few years. I’ve used it with my phone alone, with a Garmin and now with my Apple Watch. Now that I am using it with my Apple Watch, I’m realizing that it doesn’t capture calories burned. Everything works well but that. I’m not sure why this wouldn’t be an option, it seems pretty useless if it can’t even track calories.

helpful_reviews.title: Not recording full ride
helpful_reviews.author: will.i.am.1
helpful_reviews.content: Seems to be a decent app. However, lately it has been stopping on its own and then continuing all on its own. I have lost record keeping on some of my rides and more importantly on my longest ride. This really upset me because it cut out my longest and hardest ride. This is a big deal to me due to others I ride with and how I compare myself to them. Very bummed about that. Why would this happen...?

helpful_reviews.title: We don’t need a time machine
helpful_reviews.author: Kvekvevekcek
helpful_reviews.content: Long time user and fan of Strava. I hate the new algorithm based activity feed. I want the chronological feed back. There has been overwhelming backlash from the users and they aren’t listening. The social aspects of strava are fun and important to a lot of people, but the emphasis seems to be too heavy on becoming the next social network and not enough on fixing some of the technical issues. I’ll submit a better review if they start listening.

helpful_reviews.title: Great APP for runners/cyclists
helpful_reviews.author: Roadbykerr
helpful_reviews.content: Strava is an awesome way to see how you run and ride and compare to others. Also a great way to hook up with friends, or make new ones!! Very easy to use and navigate. Also great for when your Garmin is not working, you can track your event easily on your mobile device.

helpful_reviews.title: Took my money and I didn't even sign up
helpful_reviews.author: imfamousbarbie
helpful_reviews.content: I was going on a cycling tour( still am on one)and  wanted to track it and I came across this app, and thought right on just what I wanted... Well it wasn't what expected as it wanted me to sign in and put in my my credit card. So I exited the app and deleted it. Next thing I know my card had been charged. 7.99 put me in the negative ( so that's an extra 30 bucks for bank over draft fees) and when on a bicycling tour I only keep enough in the account to cover my bills.

helpful_reviews.title: On your phone, login or signup using the Strava app
helpful_reviews.author: cjmitche
helpful_reviews.content: Apple Watch 3 GPS+Cellular...opening on the watch asks for login or signup on the phone.  No other options available.  Starting an activity on the phone makes no difference.  Watch has been added as a device on the phone app, full permission granted, etc.  Won’t run on the watch at all.

helpful_reviews.title: Big display, easy to see the essentials
helpful_reviews.author: walk4health
helpful_reviews.content: I track my cycling rides with Strava now as their interface is the best to use. The info I need to see is large, and everything can be seen at a glance on my bike mounted iPhone. Strava has done a great job over the years continually improving their app. So useful to me.

helpful_reviews.title: Strava app fails to record
helpful_reviews.author: cbseven
helpful_reviews.content: One star: App is intermittently and incorrectly pausing. Unreliable recording makes it useless for recording rides and sharing location. When can we expect a fix? This issue seems to have been hounding me since iOS 11 update.  UPDATE to three stars: Version 39 installed and I can (tentatively) say that the issue did not rear its ugly head when recording a ride yesterday I’ll test more and update.

helpful_reviews.title: Great tool,
helpful_reviews.author: Dkdrdjsnbehxjjabdb
helpful_reviews.content: I love tracking my activities with strava, I use it multiple times a week. I have two wishes to improve my use of this app. I wish I could search/sort my activities to find a specific run and I wish the statistics portion of my profile show my fastest 1k, 5k, 10k, etc with the option to click on that activity. Thanks for such a great app!

helpful_reviews.title: Last update broke the apple interface
helpful_reviews.author: MegKate28
helpful_reviews.content: I love using Strava and have not had many issues, but with the most recent update my calorie information no longer syncs with the apple health app even though the workout and exercise time does without any issue. Little disappointed I guess I have to wear my Apple Watch during all rides to ensure I get credit for all of my workouts.

helpful_reviews.title: Unable to remove kudos or “un-kudos”
helpful_reviews.author: Latte Rob
helpful_reviews.content: I’m not renewing further till they add this since there is no way to remove a kudos after accidentally giving kudos. FB has this, why can’t Strava? There have many many requests after years have gone by. While I would give it a 1-star, at least other area are working and app does have some usefulness. Also I’ve been receiving kudos from unknown people with porn profiles. Finally last straw and will not renew.

helpful_reviews.title: User
helpful_reviews.author: Bikingmikeb
helpful_reviews.content: The last two updates to this app have just made it go from bad to worse. I know you need to keep your developers employed, fix the bugs, but making changes for the sake of making changes is not progress. You need to revert back a couple versions. Does anybody there actually use this app?

helpful_reviews.title: The usefulness is fading quickly
helpful_reviews.author: Hdhjdjcncnjdjs
helpful_reviews.content: I have the free version.  I am never going to pay for premium. With that said the newest update just made this app even less valuable then the previous ones.  Now I cant even see my weekly totals unless I upgrade to premium.  I realize it is not free to build and maintain but come on.   How petty can you be as a company to not even let me see a total of my activities.  I just hope I can still export my activity history for free.   But I am sure there will be a fee for that too.

helpful_reviews.title: Doesnt record my runs
helpful_reviews.author: hosannagrace
helpful_reviews.content: Don’t get this app if you don’t want to be frustrated. It literally decides when it wants to record my runs and when it doesn’t. Today I got back from a long run only to find that Strava hadn’t even recorded the first mile, even though I had pushed start. It also gave me the wrong time. Sometimes it records them perfectly, but sometimes it doesn’t record at all. Please fix this, it’s getting ridiculous.

helpful_reviews.title: KOM listings and Weekly/Monthly segment times please!!
helpful_reviews.author: Crashdevil13
helpful_reviews.content: Great app! But it would be great to be able able to see my or others KOMs listed on their profiles.   Also, can we please get week/month rankings on segments on the mobile app??   As of now these things can only be done on the website.

helpful_reviews.title: FALSE KOM’s
helpful_reviews.author: AJSHERER22
helpful_reviews.content: Huge fan of strava! My only suggestion would be to somehow flag/remove those people who earned a KOM by accidentally or purposefully leaving their strava on in there car. It’s usually pretty obvious to tell when you analyze their ride and segment. Running up hill at 40mph huh? Everything else is on point! Thanks guys!

helpful_reviews.title: Solid
helpful_reviews.author: SunTunes
helpful_reviews.content: This has worked well for the past two years tracking my mileage and mapping my commutes. Had a recent hiccup with GPS reception over the last week; Strava support was very helpful getting to the root cause. Turned out to be an iOS update I’d missed. Back on the trail!

helpful_reviews.title: Beware if using for a runbet
helpful_reviews.author: chrissy78nur
helpful_reviews.content: I was required to use either this or runkeeper for a runbet to track runs. Went for my first run tonight, which needed to be at least 30 mins. I purposely ran 32 to give myself a buffer in case the app was glitchy. I went to submit my run on runbet, and I was rejected for being too short. Some how my time was miraculously lowered to under 29 minutes. Now, after working a long stressful shift as a nurse on my feet all day...I’m at the gym trying to get another 30 minutes in :/ very frustrating!

helpful_reviews.title: Having issues
helpful_reviews.author: Jobugdoodle
helpful_reviews.content: The app has worked really well up until this week. It will track my runs perfectly, but when I save them it does not save the whole run, only half. I’m not sure if it’s in the app or the iPhone update. Just be aware and keep a close eye on it if you like to keep accurate times.

helpful_reviews.title: Review for the Apple Watch App.
helpful_reviews.author: Sir James Silva
helpful_reviews.content: The Apple Watch app is great as a stand alone Strava app when you can’t take your phone (or Garmin) with you. However, when one has there phone with them, the app should know and have the capability to simply sync to the iPhone app and mirror its data. It would be great to have a map on my phone screen mounted to my handle bars and data like mph and heart rate displaying on my watch.

helpful_reviews.title: Turn-by-Turn
helpful_reviews.author: MacPanther
helpful_reviews.content: I love Strava. It rocks I so many ways. The only thing it lacks is turn-by-turn cueing on routes. I realize this is an oft-repeated request, and that you have addressed it. I realize it opens a Pandora’s box. But implementing the feature set would take a great app and make it a killer one.

helpful_reviews.title: Using offline makes this a no brainer
helpful_reviews.author: lindyboi
helpful_reviews.content: Once I learned I could still track GPS location in low power and/or airplane mode, my battery survives several-hour rides. Makes tracking and showing off easy!

helpful_reviews.title: Apple Watch App Rating.
helpful_reviews.author: Benomas1123
helpful_reviews.content: Not sure if anyone else is having this issue, but when using Strava on the series 3 Apple Watch the program pauses every time I look at it to see my pacing and time. It gets annoying that I can’t look at my watch as it will auto pause and interrupt the recording. It’s good for what it does but is there a way to fix this feature with auto pause ?

helpful_reviews.title: My running buddy!
helpful_reviews.author: Jakezxcv
helpful_reviews.content: Easy to use, accurate, fun challenges, stay in touch with friends...and race against their times. Only thing I would change would be to indicate hundredths of a mile, not just 2.1, for example...2.18mi like some other apps do. Thanks for a great product!

helpful_reviews.title: Runner’s Request
helpful_reviews.author: plinx0r
helpful_reviews.content: Love the app and use it on the Apple Watch all the time. Is it possible to have more granular distance displayed on the watch? Instead of 1.4 miles I would like to see 1.45 miles. Also, is it possible to add audio cues for half or quarter miles? Helpful for workouts.

helpful_reviews.title: PR but no rankings
helpful_reviews.author: Procyclist457
helpful_reviews.content: I use a wahoo ELEMNT bolt and I just got back from a ride. I got a PR on a segment and my time shows that I should be in the top 10. On the overview it says I have my PR but when I go to the rankings it shows my older PR and says I’m in 26th place when it should say 6th. My PR shows but it does not count as a top 10. I have not checked off “private” nor “hide from segment leaderboards.” There should not be bugs like this especially when people pay for premium.

helpful_reviews.title: Missing key feature from mobile
helpful_reviews.author: Reviewer-1978
helpful_reviews.content: You need to be able to save or create a route from a friend’s activity directly from the mobile app.  Great app overall though.  I think personally it would also be nice to be able to like comments and pm a user directly.  But mainly the first thing.

helpful_reviews.title: It’s getting annoying.
helpful_reviews.author: MIGerlag97
helpful_reviews.content: I’m a premium subscriber and I cycle 3 to 4 times a week but I never run, I hate that my statistics always show 0km until I go inside and move to the cycling tab.  It would be nice if you could add an option to customize the sports that show on the profile tab or to at least choose the default one, in my case make the default cycling instead of running.  It would also be nice if you could bring the cropping feature from the website over to the app.  A separate Strava beacon app instead of a website based option would also be cool for those who just want to view your location when you’re out cycling or whatever.

helpful_reviews.title: Improvements
helpful_reviews.author: Wesley Let It Rip
helpful_reviews.content: To the developers. Let us post videos. It will make it more interesting. Also let us tag our Strava friends with our pictures.  Let us also create photo albums like on different trails we rode on. Help us also rate the trails we rode on with stars.

helpful_reviews.title: Question about maps
helpful_reviews.author: kcfromva
helpful_reviews.content: Nice app! One question: the map shown on my feed shows trails that connect to the roads. When I click on that map to get to a larger one, the trails are gone. Can you change that so that the larger map shows them too?

helpful_reviews.title: Crashes and loses data regularly
helpful_reviews.author: christopher zachory
helpful_reviews.content: I’ve been using Strava for about 3 months. I’m pay the monthly subscription fee. The features are nice, but the app is unreliable. I’ve lost data numerous times. I ride everyday and have lost data while riding and while the auto-pause was activated. I’ve contacted customer service 3 times and sent “crash reports”. Strava tech  support doesn’t seem to have a clue about what is wrong. Mapmyride is more reliable.

helpful_reviews.title: Good App
helpful_reviews.author: AZPrimative
helpful_reviews.content: I use it for running and riding. But this morning the time ran but no pace or distance showed. I ran a normal route that didn’t have any issue before. Tried to restart and it did the same again. End up having to close the app entirely. Little annoying in the middle of a run but overall I like the app.

helpful_reviews.title: Great app and easy to use
helpful_reviews.author: Shannon Dash
helpful_reviews.content: I have been using Strava for the past several years and it’s made cycling a much more challenging and enjoyable experience than I originally anticipated.   Most recently I use the integration with my Bolt Element for cycling and can get live segments on my computer while riding.   Great app!

helpful_reviews.title: Good for social fitness
helpful_reviews.author: Ragnar582
helpful_reviews.content: It appears to sync with Apple health now. They also use meters and yards in swimming finally, which is great! Miles and kilometers for lap swimming was a joke. Still no swimming with the Apple Watch, unfortunate as I’m a swimmer/cyclist but not a runner.   I would love to see them give that green through red graph for your speed on the map the way Nike and Apple do in their apps.

helpful_reviews.title: Beautiful app with a tiny community
helpful_reviews.author: J T. R
helpful_reviews.content: I have pushed my Garmin Connect data to Strava for years. It has an elegant design and solid social features, but what’s most frustrating is how few people seem engaged in the community. While many friends have signed up, only a handful are active users. I can’t tell if that’s a commentary on Strava or American fitness, but it leaves me wanting more in the app.

helpful_reviews.title: Probably wouldn’t ride without Strava
helpful_reviews.author: Heart Attack Randy
helpful_reviews.content: Strava, and it’s segments, has made riding awesome. Both myself and my coworkers compete furiously for segment times and trophies. Very fun!  The only improvement I would suggest would be to allow one to view all of the leaderboard names on segments on mobile devices.

helpful_reviews.title: Surprised!
helpful_reviews.author: Ricci a Bilotta
helpful_reviews.content: I had a feeling that this would work. I use an old iPhone. I don’t get WiFi, except when I’m home. I didn’t think the gps would’ve able to keep track of where I went without WiFi. But there it was on the map! I was indeed surprised. Thanx!!

helpful_reviews.title: Hard to track miles
helpful_reviews.author: This dragoon
helpful_reviews.content: It would be nice if the app allowed for activity tracking in increments of .00 instead of .0. I left some feedback for the devs about this a while ago, but didn’t see any update. Other than that, this app is more reliable than the Nike app. But I may go back to it because at least on there the miles are tracked more accurately.

helpful_reviews.title: Great app
helpful_reviews.author: @briannorris1
helpful_reviews.content: Would be even greater if you can easily stop a ride or run from home screen on a phone instead of having to unlock the phone. It would be like stop/pause music, shows up a control on home screen

helpful_reviews.title: Good and getting better, but...
helpful_reviews.author: burnall
helpful_reviews.content: I mostly only use the Apple Watch app, which is still lacking features like marking splits/laps, which Apple’s Workout app can do. Cadence for running is measured but not reported (again, Apple’s workout app can do this).  Given this, will use Apple’s workout app for recording activities and use iPhone app for reviewing results, etc. New strain feature looks good so far.

helpful_reviews.title: Was Great app
helpful_reviews.author: Seanburl
helpful_reviews.content: I have been a advocate for Strava and have got many of my friends to use it over the last 5 years. The Recent updates have gamed it up like other social media platforms, at first I thought my garmin was acting up but turned out it’s just the new sorting algorithm. Maybe I’ll just use my garmin connect app as it basically does what I liked about Strava without the extra social bs being shoved down my throat. Go back to chronological ordering and stop trying to be another Facebook please.

helpful_reviews.title: Frustrated. EXTREMELY
helpful_reviews.author: tlbro
helpful_reviews.content: I am a cyclist and bike 5 days a week. I like to track my miles and time and personal best. Strava has recently had an ‘upgrade’ that now automatically stops my timer if my bike stops.  And it doesn’t start back up when I move. Before the upgrade I could deselect this feature. Cool for runners. Stinks for bikers. And now I can’t find that feature to turn it off again. Is this an attempt to get everyone to purchase the ‘upgrade’. If so, no thanks. I’ll find another app.

helpful_reviews.title: It’s my needs.
helpful_reviews.author: embroidery runner
helpful_reviews.content: I enjoy strava because I’m able to not only see my workouts but also track mileage on my shoes and see how some of my friends are doing. It’s basic enough for anyone to use but comprehensive enough to give me all the data.

helpful_reviews.title: Strava
helpful_reviews.author: Crash recover back to myself
helpful_reviews.content: Love using this app. It’s gotten better over the years. It’s a great way to keep a record of your accomplishments and Miles throughout the year. It’s encouraging to have the challenges to sign up for. Great way to stay connected with other cycling friends and athletes.

helpful_reviews.title: Feature request
helpful_reviews.author: iracecars
helpful_reviews.content: I’ve been using Strava for a few years to record my bike rides, both for fitness and my commute. I would really love to have basic weather features like temperature and humidity added (or integrated from a 3rd parry app?).. It’s very hot and humid where I live and this has a direct impact on my work out routine.

helpful_reviews.title: Game breaking flaw
helpful_reviews.author: ChrisH92isthisonefree
helpful_reviews.content: Good app except the whole point is to connect with your friends while using it. So why in the world is it so difficult to do so? To add a friend it requires you to add your whole contact list, but doesn’t sort them alphabetically or give you the ability to search through them. So I have 500+ contacts, am I supposed to scroll through all them to find the two I want to invite? Fix this.

helpful_reviews.title: Love it...update us on what you’re changing
helpful_reviews.author: Mtnbiker98
helpful_reviews.content: Love that strava is getting updated frequently. REALLY wish that you’d publish what changes you are making in each update. Can’t look for new improvements if  I don’t know where to find them. Thanks!

helpful_reviews.title: Great functionality, fun to use
helpful_reviews.author: Freeyerheel
helpful_reviews.content: Great App. It's fun and motivating to see your friends out exercising! Distances can be a little off, think this has to do with GPS tracking interval setting. However, more frequent GPS pings use more battery power, so feel the app strikes a good balance.

helpful_reviews.title: Great App! Awful Updates!
helpful_reviews.author: CTAnderson
helpful_reviews.content: I love the app. However, every single time thatâ€™s driver get an update, it stopped working on my AppleWatch.  To fix the problem, I must uninstall from my phone, uninstall from my watch, reboot both devices, reinstall on my phone, and then reinstall on my watch. I will call rate this about two more times. Can we get the updates to work?

helpful_reviews.title: Please make these fixes!!
helpful_reviews.author: luke dom
helpful_reviews.content: 1. Please fix the robotic voice. Hard to understand. 2. Also, please add in hundredth decimal place on runs (e.g., 1.98 vs. 1.9). 3. Please provide the options to select / deselect what feedback the runner gets during run. Specifically, one thing missing right now is average pace. The app tells you current pace and last mile in, but doesnâ€™t provide your average pace. This would be a great feature to add especially to race runners.

helpful_reviews.title: Too Many Issues
helpful_reviews.author: SP Tunes
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve been using Strava for several years now, but itâ€™s stopped working lately. It often misreads my runs, doesnâ€™t record distance, or skips parts of my run. Iâ€™ve tried everything to fix it, but it just wonâ€™t work. Runkeeper works fine-even while I have them going at the same time. Itâ€™s a bummer because I have all my data on Strava, but I think Iâ€™m going to have to move on.

helpful_reviews.title: Struggling Since Beginning Of This Year
helpful_reviews.author: JMDein
helpful_reviews.content: Sadly Iâ€™ve decided to leave Strava.  The idea is great and the gamification of segments and tracking is an awesome feature but since the beginning of the year the GPS signal just drops and all your data for a run isnâ€™t recorded (making the gamification pretty useless).  Decided despite 5 years of data on Strava, Iâ€™m going with a more reliable tracking app until they can get the bugs fixed that started at the beginning of this year.

helpful_reviews.title: Best cycling/running app
helpful_reviews.author: ammesick
helpful_reviews.content: I use Strava to record my bike rides, runs, backcountry skiing, etc. Great to keep track of your adventures and see what your friends are up to.  I do wish that you could crop a ride from within the app when you forget to stop your garmin :/

helpful_reviews.title: Great on iPhone.  â€œiPad appâ€� is just magnified iPhone app
helpful_reviews.author: Need more coffee
helpful_reviews.content: Title says it all. Iâ€™ve been using Strava for years and love it, but while reading on my iPad, the Strava website said there was an iPad app available. However, itâ€™s just the general iPhone app thatâ€™s magnified on to the iPad screen, and itâ€™s frustratingly use.

helpful_reviews.title: Itâ€™s the app
helpful_reviews.author: Will Winn
helpful_reviews.content: If it didnâ€™t happen on strava, did it even happen?  I use it for all my running. Good or bad runs, it all gets posted. The social aspect is a lot stronger than most other fitness apps Iâ€™ve seen. I wish there was a â€œtrailâ€� surface function though.

helpful_reviews.title: GPS is way off after update
helpful_reviews.author: chrish052
helpful_reviews.content: Apple Watch: After the latest update, my runs are all messed up. GPS map looks crazy. Last run has me running in the middle of the Niagara River. Please fix this and hire better QA engineers.  Update: Installed the latest release and it appears to have mostly solved the GPS issue.

helpful_reviews.title: Amazing App
helpful_reviews.author: Jace Fisher
helpful_reviews.content: This app is amazing. It records well most of the time and is great when you want to compete with friends or fellow athletes. Only one time did it have a hard time on the auto stop & go feature, but it was slow technical mountain biking. So, I give this app a 4 star. (I have used it for over a year now)

helpful_reviews.title: Overcharged me
helpful_reviews.content: I downloaded the standard version for a 30 day trial about a month ago, I decided the app itself was accurate and did what I wanted it to do so I decided to keep it on a monthly basis ($7.99 per month). Theyâ€™ve since charged me $60 for an entire year and have not returned any emails about bringing my subscription back to the correct term. This is shady practice and shows they are clearly taking advantage of mistake with their users. DONT DOWNLOAD THIS APP. Use Nike Run Club or Underarmour free apps for tracking.

helpful_reviews.title: Wonâ€™t tell how long Iâ€™ve been running for
helpful_reviews.author: Leon_Fot
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve been using the app for a month or so, and the last week Iâ€™ve had it, whenever I run, for any length at all, it wonâ€™t tell me what distance Iâ€™ve been running for until the end, which isnâ€™t helpful! I would give 5 stars except for that...

helpful_reviews.title: Better indoor spin options would be a plus!
helpful_reviews.author: LeonardoMCMLVII
helpful_reviews.content: Wanted to add my indoor spin bike to the list of bikes, but an indoor spin was not an option. Not all of us use trainers with our road bikes.  The app however, proved to be very accurate on my road outings. Compared to the Garman 920XT on a 40 mile ride, I find to only be a 0.1 or 0.2 miles difference.

helpful_reviews.title: Amazing app - update needs tweaks
helpful_reviews.author: Jadrin
helpful_reviews.content: Will update feedback if fixed. But why do the splits graph bars increase with faster pace?! The previous way makes a lot more sense. Please fix it. Extremely thankful to have the splits on the workout main view though. This is a 5 Star app for any cyclist or runner. No experience with swimming.

helpful_reviews.title: Crowdsourced coaching
helpful_reviews.author: Boji Bear
helpful_reviews.content: I always struggled sharing my training/racing successes and failures on social media, because most people are not interested.  Strava gives me the tools to communicate with people I respect and I can find strength from all of their efforts.  Thanks for a great app and fostering an amazing community.

helpful_reviews.title: Distance accuracy questionable, new voice is terrible
helpful_reviews.author: Shep88
helpful_reviews.content: Please give us the old voice cues back. The new male voice is too robotic and hard to hear with any background noise. There needs to be some way to calibrate for distance. My events consistently record 5% higher mileage than anyone else I ride or hike with.
