Some using IOS like me, some using Garmin. 6 people on the same 10 mile MTB ride an 6 different mileage recordings.

helpful_reviews.title: Itâ€™s okay
helpful_reviews.author: Musicpowered
helpful_reviews.content: If you want anything more than a map of the route you just rode or your average speed, distance and time. There are plenty of apps that do that. Strava seems to think they should charge for any little option after that like goal distance for the week. How is this a feature that should cost a monthly fee to use?

helpful_reviews.title: Communityâ€™s Great, but Features Neglected
helpful_reviews.author: Mike Verde
helpful_reviews.content: Just not enough control in how to view and manage uploaded content. Canâ€™t choose what content in an activity to make public and what not to, such as start time. Really illogical workarounds for things like this, such as making entire activities either hidden or visible to the public. Premium definitely not worth it.

helpful_reviews.title: Excellent app if the calorie count worked
helpful_reviews.author: Piixiipants
helpful_reviews.content: I have been using this app for cycling and running for a few years now. However, I keep switching back to other apps as the calorie count keeps overestimating by  nearly 100%. This issue has been brought up by many users on Strava but sadly it hasnâ€™t gotten fixed yet.   Please fix this issue, Strava!

helpful_reviews.title: Overall a good app
helpful_reviews.author: ur2ez22
helpful_reviews.content: But lots of opportunity for improvements too. Would be great if we could filter for certain workouts by date range, distance range, workout type, who we worked out with, equipment, etc. for both our workouts and friends workouts.

helpful_reviews.title: Still a problem
helpful_reviews.author: Litespeedrider
helpful_reviews.content: I donâ€™t know whether itâ€™s Strava, iOS12 Health app or WatchOS5 Activity app but calories from Strava workouts are not flowing to either Health or Activity. The workouts appear on Health and Activity but not the calories.  Iâ€™ve done all the typical fixes including reinstalling Strava but the problem persists for both my wife and I. Hopefully either Strava or Apple or both will address this.

helpful_reviews.title: Compare with Friends Feature
helpful_reviews.author: Ohnocurly
helpful_reviews.content: What happened? Seeing how I ranked compared to those I follow was the only reason I used Strava over Map my Ride or the other options... disappointed...edit: fixed! Thanks for listening!!

helpful_reviews.title: Step above garbage.
helpful_reviews.author: ynotgreg
helpful_reviews.content: Download two years ago. Seemed fine. Worked well with â€œreliveâ€� app. Now it prompts to upgrade to premium constantly. Drops my GPS signal on every ride, and robs me of my miles and effort. I have turned off the pause function but app still screws me every ride. Iâ€™ll bet if I upgrade to premium from the free app things would suddenly work like a charm! No thanks. Keep looking there are better apps that are free.

helpful_reviews.title: Watch App Doesnâ€™t Work
helpful_reviews.author: intermediatic
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™m getting ready to sell my Apple Watch. Over a year and it is still borked. I press start on my phone and the watch app just sits there like a muppet on a rock. It used to display information about my run and allow me to finish the run on my phone from the watch. It also used to collect heart rate. Now the watch app is some garbage that doesnâ€™t work. Get a grip Strava, there is a massive thread about this on your site. Why oh why do I pay to be a premium member?

helpful_reviews.title: Problems lately with Apple Watch
helpful_reviews.author: Toddrun
helpful_reviews.content: I have loved Strava. The stats, the tracking, the social part. I was so happy I became a premium member. But lately Iâ€™m so frustrated and need to find another way. On key Race days or training runs the app on my watch just shuts down mid-run and performs what looks to be an update. My time and mileage get corrupted and I no longer have accurate splits. Why?  Iâ€™ve turned off automatic updates. Frustrated...

helpful_reviews.title: Motion Not Detected
helpful_reviews.author: Hoggie.hogg
helpful_reviews.content: Recently activities are randomly unable to save due to â€œmotion not being detectedâ€� even though pace and distance updates are given (albeit inaccurately) during activity.   When working as designed, great app and makes the cost of Apple Watch worth it! When working properly...

helpful_reviews.title: Good, but could be better
helpful_reviews.author: Matthew Hinman
helpful_reviews.content: A good tracking app. I use it for cycling but it lacks a lot of features. Would be better if audio cues were available and customizable similar to MapMyRideâ€™s abilities. Shouldnâ€™t be a difficult addition as they already have audio cues for running. I use it with my AW3 with no problems but really want the audio features.

helpful_reviews.title: Mapping issue
helpful_reviews.author: theMonkeyMarkyMonk
helpful_reviews.content: I have been having trouble with the app completely mapping my hikes.  It sometimes â€œdrawsâ€� a straight line somewhere in the middle of a hike.  It has also cut off a hike on either the front or back end of a hike.   I have been using it for about three months and it was great.  But now itâ€™s acting up.

helpful_reviews.title: Strava fail today
helpful_reviews.author: comeonstrava
helpful_reviews.content: Today strava on Apple Watch was a mess! Continually auto paused while in motion the entire ride. Mph was also way off, at times it would pause and read 0mph while at a decent pace. This also drastically affected mileage. Please fix!!!

helpful_reviews.title: Sollllit
helpful_reviews.author: jssjdjdjjsj
helpful_reviews.content: Love the app, love the idea more. As far as a suggestion is concerned i know you get notified if you lose a KOM/CR but Iâ€™d love to have a notification sent out if anyone you follow passes you on a segment leaderboard. That would keep friends dueling for certain segments. Of course an option to turn that off would be a good call too.

helpful_reviews.title: Logs double in Apple watch
helpful_reviews.author: rlyn85
helpful_reviews.content: I like that it works with my Apple Watch and the activity app. BUT if I enter my previously logged runs from the Apple Watch workout app, then it adds them and sometimes twice into the activity app. Even if I delete them from the activity app it eventually shows back up therefore throwing off all of my workouts.

helpful_reviews.title: Canâ€™t detect movement?
helpful_reviews.author: bateshy
helpful_reviews.content: A recent issue has come up where at the end of a run/ride, the app on my Apple Watch says it canâ€™t save the activity because it canâ€™t detect movement so I have no choice but to discard (even though it has recorded properly for the duration of the workout)!! So incredibly frustrating! I love to track my workouts but canâ€™t risk this happening!

helpful_reviews.title: Great app with room for an improvement!
helpful_reviews.author: Odicous
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™d love to see freshness and fitness brought to mobile AND the option to toggle races on and off for better viewing of the fitness line and itâ€™s trajectory. Iâ€™d love to see the desktop version fitness and freshness be updated as well so that the actual size of the graph can be increased. For example, Iâ€™d love to utilize my 4K monitors pixels to increase viewing.

helpful_reviews.title: Love XC Skiing feature!
helpful_reviews.author: MN barefoot
helpful_reviews.content: Seriously, no one else has a feature for XC Ski that works with Apple Watch.  Itâ€™s picks up gps signal quickly with Apple Watch.  Only negative with watch-is sometimes it locks you out and says â€œplease use your phone to login.â€� When I check my iPhone the Strava app is open and running.

helpful_reviews.author: Aleja4255
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve been using Strava for over a year. When I first downloaded Strava, there was no confusion. The app is extremely straightforward and simplified to what you need. I am a cyclist, and I love the community sense behind Strava.  Itâ€™s auto detection of stopping is excellent as well. #stravaproveit

helpful_reviews.title: Nice when it works
helpful_reviews.author: Dval44
helpful_reviews.content: I just had the Apple Watch app delete a 15 mile run, which was an important one for me to record. I have one other long run stuck in limbo where I can â€œsyncâ€� then it tells me thereâ€™s no connection.   The app on the watch while itâ€™s going is 9 out of 10. The issues uploading and syncing bring the overall down to less than average. Unbelievably frustrating.

helpful_reviews.title: Has made cycling more exciting!
helpful_reviews.author: sharoon saleem
helpful_reviews.content: As a tech guy myself, I canâ€™t help but appreciate the awesome app that Strava is. It has made cycling so exciting and social that you get hooked. From the leaderboards, analysis to the exhilarating sense of competition - this is the gold standard for a sports based social platform.

helpful_reviews.title: Works well but...
helpful_reviews.author: Graysons dad
helpful_reviews.content: I like the app. Itâ€™s easy to read. Easy to toggle between average pace and splits. The only negative I see is that I have to have my phone nearby to sync from my watch. I have the Apple Watch 3 with cellular and I think the strava app should support this so that I can really leave my phone at home

helpful_reviews.title: App needs serious help
helpful_reviews.author: mtg112
helpful_reviews.content: Only running app that consistently messes up gps after every update. At some point you would think you could play music through app as well. At very least be able to update distance when god fails without having to delete and manually add run. Losing all premium data in process. Seriously considering saving my money next year.

helpful_reviews.title: Hoping for splits on AW
helpful_reviews.author: War overt

helpful_reviews.title: Gives my inner nerd an outlet

helpful_reviews.title: Great app but it has stopped working

helpful_reviews.title: Great app for cycling

helpful_reviews.title: Hands down Awesome

Homie don’t play that game! Going back to Runkeeper! Too bad too. I liked the data it gave me.

helpful_reviews.title: App crashes after recent update

helpful_reviews.title: Great App

helpful_reviews.title: Fix start times
helpful_reviews.author: whoopsiedoodle
helpful_reviews.content: Start times are wrong. Every activity I do, whether directly using the app or syncing from Fitbit, is said to have started 5 hours (exactly) earlier.   Update: Figured out why. It will only happen when HR data from Fitbit doesn’t sync. Strava and Fitbit never work to sync, but when it does this happens. I reconnect them, then I allow Strava health related permissions, but it doesn’t work.

helpful_reviews.title: Very good, could really do with the ability to change the main page layout.

helpful_reviews.title: Love this App! Great motivation.

Paying what I am, the app should be a lot better. Fix the Apple Watch app please!

helpful_reviews.title: Please put overall time to the second!
helpful_reviews.author: (:xcrunnerforever:)
helpful_reviews.content: After the latest update, Strava changed the overall time to the nearest minute, but it is much better at the nearest second. Please change it back!  (Overall, the app is great! That is my only concern)

helpful_reviews.title: LOVE this app.

helpful_reviews.title: Poor data

helpful_reviews.title: Actual Trash

helpful_reviews.title: Fix it
helpful_reviews.author: OH GEE SHOWTIME
helpful_reviews.content: I have used this app for years love it but for the last 2 to 3 weeks it’s been displaying my morning rides to afternoon ridesmy afternoon rides to morning rides and it is not tracking the correct mileage. I have quite a few friends that use it and we are all experiencing the same thing! Strava people fix it!

helpful_reviews.title: Updates needed
helpful_reviews.author: mudrock5000
helpful_reviews.content: Upgraded to premium for the speedometer.   The speedometer screen could use improvement.   Why drop the average from it?  I liked seeing that.   Add the time of day to that screen. Commuting riders need that. And the phones clock is too small  Move the record/ stop button away from right above the home button.  I’ve hit stop on accident several times.   Allow greater editing of rides.  Fill in missing pieces with extrapolated data from other rides of mine.

helpful_reviews.title: Just okay!
helpful_reviews.author: geezfools
helpful_reviews.content: Seems to work okay most of the time. Really annoying that you stopped posting your bug fixes and other info when you update the app. Now just generic tag line with every update, why are more and more apps doing this?!?!

helpful_reviews.title: Iffy tracking
helpful_reviews.author: Hungry Dave
helpful_reviews.content: I’ve used the app about half a dozen times and I’m about 50-50 for what actually gets tracked. Coming from Nike run club, I wasn’t expecting this issue (NRC rarely failed) but this is pretty frequent. I’d still be on NRC if it was able to track cycling. These issues make the app not fun.

helpful_reviews.title: Clears settings with every update

helpful_reviews.content: Strava devs need to learn how to build an update that doesn’t clear my settings.   With each of the last few updates, the following have been erased: -my audio cue preferences -auto-pause Run preference -run history stored on watch  I wouldn’t be surprised if other settings also reverted to the default when the app updated but I haven’t noticed them yet. helpful_reviews.title: Runner Social Media at it's Best

helpful_reviews.title: Great app!  Just one wish...

helpful_reviews.content: Strava is great. Now a subscriber. My favorite feature is live segments. It really motivates you to push yourself harder.  I just wish live segments worked on the Apple Watch.

helpful_reviews.title: Strava for Mobile
helpful_reviews.author: jaeeman21
helpful_reviews.content: Can we please make it possible to see the laps on a mobile device like we can on the browser.   Thank you

helpful_reviews.title: GPS is spotty

helpful_reviews.title: Extremely Buggy

EASY WORKOUT MODE - GPS map of your walks; - audio instructions to each training; - detailed statistics; - easy access to music, audiobooks and podcasts right from the app; - manual editing of workouts.  MUSIC TIMED TO YOUR WORKOUT - unlimited access to the best workout music right from the app; - music tempo adjusts to your workout rhythm – music plays faster as you walk faster; - new mixes from talented DJs are available every day; - all genres – from Classical and Oldies to Rock, Hip-hop and R&B; - convenient search and suggestions to find perfect mixes.  STAY MOTIVATED - dozens of tips on walking, healthy nutrition and lifestyle; - synchronization with Apple Health app; - integration with Runkeeper, Fitbit, MapMyRun; - share your achievements, walking stats and even routes with your friends in Facebook and Twitter. ==================== Should you choose to upgrade to a Premium Membership, payment will be charged to your iTunes account at confirmation of purchase. It really makes you not want to read the stuff (which I haven't)! I understand that you have a premium service. That's great and once I've been able to use the app, if I really enjoy it, I'll consider the premium service. recent_reviews.title: This people are rip off artists- beware
recent_reviews.author: old time radio fanatic
recent_reviews.content: I tried this app naively not knowing they were putting me on auto renewal. When I try to dance they direct me to a site that they do not have a cancel button on. Apple should list them as a bad app and take them off the website

recent_reviews.title: Nice
recent_reviews.author: Say Sengly
recent_reviews.content: Nice

recent_reviews.title: Horrible
recent_reviews.author: Kengeenb363
recent_reviews.content: It has to do two things. Keep your time and your distance and it canâ€™t do either. Save your money

recent_reviews.title: No thanks
recent_reviews.author: Spicy McHaggis
recent_reviews.content: I found the first five minutes with this app so aggravating that I have already deleted it from my phone. People, if you are looking for a free app to track your progress, keep looking. This is a free app designed strictly to shake money out of your pocket. The free version is only useful if you believe you donâ€™t have enough commercials in your life.

recent_reviews.title: Umm
recent_reviews.author: ğŸ˜�cheep
recent_reviews.content: Couldnâ€™t even put my age or weight without like 4 ads popping up smh uninstalling

recent_reviews.title: Not even trying..
recent_reviews.author: nikcolestorm
recent_reviews.content: I would suggest finding a way to have No Ads or money request for 15 days. Let us know it is coming but then the customer can get in , try it, love it â€”- then request the premium and run your sponsors after. I am not downloading until this is an option.

recent_reviews.title: Itâ€™s not easy to use this
recent_reviews.author: Crabapple44
recent_reviews.content: It took trial and error to get this working right while on my treadmill. Paid the 9.99, and it worked. Learned to lock the screen, but canâ€™t turn off the music. Had to walk outside, and for some reason, it needed to keep restarting, and lost all of the work that I had done. Makes me sad.

recent_reviews.title: Donâ€™t read fake reviews. This is not free!
recent_reviews.author: Fsumel023
recent_reviews.content: App is free to download... then you get to choose to either pay monthly, or to have a 7 day trial where you will automatically be charged more than 3 times the cost per month in the monthly paying subscription. This is NOT FREE! Waste of time unless you want to pay for it! But then you have no trial really so you wouldnâ€™t know if you liked it or not....  Edited to add: In response to developers response belowâ€” thatâ€™s not true at all!!!! My options were as described in my review. Nice try though. Lies lies lies.

recent_reviews.title: advertised as free, but it absolutely isn't.
recent_reviews.author: @shesILL
recent_reviews.content: I don't mind paying for an app, but I don't even know if this process is even worth the $9.99 a month they're charging.

helpful_reviews.title: Updated review: still one star
helpful_reviews.author: jesslynn95
helpful_reviews.content: They really should state before downloading that it’s a subscription. Although, at this point, I shouldn’t be surprised, i haven’t been able to find a single free workout or walking app that’s actually free. And even the free trial require me to link a card to my iTunes, but I don’t use iTunes. I was able to figure out how to use the free version though so no big deal. That’s what my one star review was based on previously. Now, after reading some reviews and developer responses, and experiencing it myself first hand, I wish I could make it zero stars. If I click no on a premium membership, that means I don’t want it. I understand ads help you keep it free, but it interrupts almost every setting and page you click on, taking up half the page so you can’t read what’s underneath it, and if you try to click the “x” to close it out it just brings up the sign up page. If your going to do ads, do them periodically, make them small and LET ME CLOSE THEM. And PS developer, I don’t wanna hear how sorry you are and how my feedback will be utilized, just fix it. Don’t tell me, just do it. Because you’ve been apologizing to your users pretty much since the app came out and nothing has been done, so I’d suggest actually listening to your reviews this time before someone shuts the app down

helpful_reviews.title: Great app; too many ads.
helpful_reviews.author: mbritb
helpful_reviews.content: The app alone is great. I would totally recommend it. It's simple and easy to use.......ONCE you get past the ads. I don't mind ads. I get that that's how you make the money for providing an app for free. But good lord...you have to wait for an ad to load, close it, wait for another ad to load, the close it. Now you're at the app - you press start, all is well...but wait, you have to close another ad. Then they have this great list of resources to read to help you out.....but can only see like 3 sentences at a time because of this huge ad that you can't close out of.  It really makes you not want to read the stuff (which I haven't)! I understand that you have a premium service. That's great and once I've been able to use the app, if I really enjoy it, I'll consider the premium service. However, dealing with these in-your-face ads that make using the app difficult just make me want to delete it. So if you can just deal with the ads...great app! But the ads do kinda make it annoying. There are other walking apps that have just small banner ads at the top or bottom which don't interfere with the app itself.

helpful_reviews.title: Developer You Are NOT listening
helpful_reviews.author: Kate Gogolen
helpful_reviews.content: I was considering downloading the app to try it but after reading the reviews and especially the developers responses that is never going to happen.   ** Developer your not listening to the consumers. The same people you want to buy your app. You continue giving the same crapping responses no matter what people are telling you about the app as if you are just copying and pasting the response. Yes we get the ads will go away with the premium service however what you seem to fail to understand for some reason is if the consumer can’t use the free app without frustration they will NEVER buy into the premium service. We as consumers, your market, will buy an app if we find some type of value in it. Please don’t respond with what those are because we can read it in the app. We have to enjoy the free version enough FIRST before we buy into a paid version. Yes we understand you have ads to keep it free, we as consumers already know that. It’s how they are placed & how often. The fact that you are not really listening to any of the things people are saying and that I’m spelling it out for you suggests that either you have no idea how to run a business or you just don’t care. Either one is bad on your part.

helpful_reviews.title: Really torn
helpful_reviews.author: marinoabn
helpful_reviews.content: I want to give this app five stars. I would give this app five stars. HOWEVER, I can’t. A few months ago, I had the premium membership running version of this app which I had had for a couple of years. Then I found the walking app. I decided to try the walking app. I LOVED it. So after using it twice, I purchased the one year membership. I was able to access the music with no issues but I was only able to use one of the trainer voices. No biggie. Then, all of a sudden, I go for my usual walk as part of my training plan and I can no longer access the music. I keep getting a message to upgrade to premium service. But when I went to my account? It showed I already had premium membership. I wrote the app people to see what was up. Their response twice now has been to send me to the link to cancel my subscription, get a refund and pay again. By the way, the price is more expensive than what I’ve already paid for a year subscription. If I have already paid for the membership for the year before they’ve decided to make these changes, should my year subscription not be honored until it expires in April of next year?  I really don’t want to cancel this app.

helpful_reviews.title: Reviews
helpful_reviews.author: Korqui P.
helpful_reviews.content: So I downloaded this app and then I began to read the reviews. I’m deleting it before I even open it, and not solely because of the customer reviews but more because of the developers response to these reviews. Obviously you need to have ads in order to keep the app free but it’s clearly overwhelming to EVERYONE according to the feedback they’ve given. What’s the point of downloading the app if the ads pop up so much that you can’t even use it?? The developers just want to push that premium cost but what they fail to realize is that if people had a better experience with the free version you wouldn’t need to ignore their concerns and redirect them to lining your pockets.   Also for the record there are many apps on the App Store that also use ads to keep the free version going at no cost but at least it’s a limited amount so you can use the app peacefully.

helpful_reviews.title: 67 year old fitness fan and dancer
helpful_reviews.author: d384j
helpful_reviews.content: I love this App! For $40 a year I get so many music mixes to walk to from a range of genres. I can dance-walk to the music I enjoy and this is so motivating. I look forward to exercising even on days when my fibromyalgia pain is bad and that’s huge!!! I do arm and leg movements as I walk. I’ve lost weight while strengthening my arms and legs. My body shape is changing, amazing at my age. This is the best exercise program I’ve ever done and l’ve done tons of them. Thank you. This is a life changer. Read all the directions and make sure you “lock” the workout you’re doing to hear the instructions when the pace changes.

helpful_reviews.title: Ads
helpful_reviews.author: amrn123
helpful_reviews.content: While you can use the free version, it makes it really hard when ads take up half the screen constantly. You can’t close the ads. I don’t mind a pop up now and then, but these are constant. I’m going to try the free version for a while and see if I like it, or if the ads drive me nuts. I don’t think I will upgrade, just because the constant ads, and how big they are, have soured me on the app. But, we’ll see what happens after I try the free version for a few weeks. Also, the app makes you think you have to sign up for a paying option right from the start, which you don’t. You can close out of that and use the free version w/o paying...but then you have the huge constant ads that you can’t ever close.

helpful_reviews.title: Ads overkill
helpful_reviews.author: Best game flappy birds 2
helpful_reviews.content: The ads are REALLY annoying. I have no problem paying for a premium app, however, I would like to know what I’m getting first. It’s hard to tell whether or not I’ll like it because I can’t get past the ads. I get that you make money off them, but when you get an ad every time you push something in the app it’s a bit too much.  *** To the developers response: I won’t pay for a premium app that I don’t know whether or not I’m going to like it. The free version is virtually unusable with all the ads. Too much frustration. I’ll stick with Runkeeper & pay them for walking plans. And because you don’t care what potential users are saying, I had to downgrade you to 1 star. Your robotic response to what people are saying is really annoying. Just don’t answer at all. No one wants to pay for an app they can’t try out.

helpful_reviews.title: Springboard for Spring
helpful_reviews.author: Benedictine Deb
helpful_reviews.content: I am 61, retired and in the tropics for 6 weeks. I decided to attempt in this time to lose weight and enhance cardiovascular fitness. I saw some people I know on the ads from social media so I thought I would give it a try. I went ahead and paid the premium. I have used it 6 days and find it helpful. I wish I could see the workouts in advance. So far, I have only listened to the Motown music and thought the selection good. I appreciate the tempo automatically  increases when I am instructed to “walk briskly”. Being away from home, I don’t have access to a scale so I don’t know how much weight I will lose. I will reevaluate the app at that time.

helpful_reviews.title: Was looking to try this out
helpful_reviews.author: Sassydem
helpful_reviews.content: For my neighborhood fitness group (15-25 people) But then I read the reviews of the constant assault of pop-ups making it unusable.  I understand why they try to upsell but it sounds like you aren’t given the chance to even try what the app does.    As annoying as those ads may be, I thought the developer responses to user concerns were even more annoying - basically, we are not going to listen or take you review or concerns into consideration because we want you to spend $ to buy premium.     I’m not even a user and these reviews/responses tell me user concerns don’t matter.  I’ll save myself and my group the pop-up, upsell drama and save valuable phone space for a company that listens to its users and isn’t out to just make a buck at all costs.

helpful_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY !!!!!
helpful_reviews.author: gvillenurse
helpful_reviews.content: The just re- charged my account after I had cancelled my subscription last year!!! This is a bogus app.   DO NOT BUY!!! OR TRY THE FREE TRIAL THEY WILL TAKE YOUR MONEY!!!!  The app is NOT FREE it is 40 bucks.  I went ahead and purchased because it had great reviews well IT DID NOT WORK!!  I've contacted their support team and requested a refund and THEY WILL NOT REFUND MY MONEY FOR THIS APP THAT DOES NOT WORK!!!!  The app cut off and did not log my entire walk and the stats are very difficult to interpret.  Basically I walked and the data I had was totally wrong as it stops tracking.  I made a huge mistake and now I'm out 40 dollars and they don't care.  They just say unsubscribe so I'm not charged for another years subscription- they got my money - total rip off !! I've contacted them and iTunes support numerous times before I wrote this review .

helpful_reviews.title: Cool concept, but flawed.
helpful_reviews.author: PandoraLover1913
helpful_reviews.content: The integrated music is good enough that I'd have no problem paying for the app, except for a couple major flaws. 1) it's way too easy to delete your workout by mistake. I've been in the last few minutes, and accidentally hit the arrow that moves you to the next workout (which deleted everything you just did, no way to get back and finish your workout) and there is no need for that button!! The next workout is intended to be the next day, you would never need that button in your current workout. And 2) there should be an option to add extra walks with custom times, to allow for something like a quick 15 minute walk... and still get to take advantage of the music and tracking features.

helpful_reviews.title: Enjoying This! Music!
helpful_reviews.author: CandyPiper444
helpful_reviews.content: I’m glad I finally tried this program.  I really like the music.  There is a lot of choice.  I finally settled on Rap VS Rock and Roll as my favorite thus far.  I have only been doing two weeks but the idea of interval training with gradually increasing speed walking or running segments can hugely boost not only calories, but physical fitness as well.  They say the gradually increasing speed segments will prevent plateaus.  The music speeds up during the fast segments! I wish there was an Apple Watch app as well.  This would help me.  As for cost, it is reasonable.  Certainly cheaper than a gym membership!

helpful_reviews.title: More advertising than the real deal
helpful_reviews.author: Sumi1976
helpful_reviews.content: I was going to download the app before I read all these reviews by the users how the ads are annoying in free version. I have a couple of suggestions for the app developers: 1. Make it a time-bound free version(like a month trial free). Many other apps offer that. Make the most popular features enabled with few features keeping for the premium version. 2. I see the ads of this app at every free app I use. I’ll suggest you to first listen to your current user base and work on improving the app and spend less money on advertising it.  The app may have great utility(I have not used it yet. So don’t know much). However, if people get annoyed by the ads, It’s not going to work.  I really wanted to try this app but now I am not going to. As such I am too lazy to write reviews even for the things/services I have used. However, I was so intrigued by the negative user reviews and my interest in the app that I decided to write this review even before using the app. I will download the app if I see positive reviews at my next visit to your app. Until then Sayonara!!

helpful_reviews.title: Easy to use and awesome!
helpful_reviews.author: L Scena
helpful_reviews.content: I LOVE this app. Definitely worth the premium membership to get rid of ads so you can just hit “start” and you are on your way. The music mixes are awesome and this  app makes it brainless to just head out and push as hard as you can.  You are prompted to “warm up,” “walk” (increase your intensity), that you are half way (time to turn around) and “cool down.” It maps your routes for you as well. It’s really cool! I look forward to my walks and working through the program.

helpful_reviews.title: We get you need ads to keep it free stop repeating yourself
helpful_reviews.author: Catznipped
helpful_reviews.content: Start listening to people instead of repeating the same old crap over and over again. We totally get that you need to have advertisers to keep the app free. You don’t need to keep telling us that we know this. Hear me??  We know this. However when you make ads that cover half the screen and make the app USELESS, no one is going to use it.  There are a lot of free apps that have ads.  THEY DO NOT COVER THE WHOLE SCREEN... A simple little banner ad at the bottom of the screen that doesn’t cover up vital information works just as well. We feel you are doing this on purpose forcing us to spend $40.   If that is your endgame we will all stop using it.

helpful_reviews.title: Didn’t get past the free trial
helpful_reviews.author: Bev in Texas
helpful_reviews.content: So I wanted to try Verv after seeing it advertised on IG (great job with the advertising!)   I didn’t get past the “one week free trial” page. Please know that if you don’t cancel your free trial 24 hours before your week is up you are automatically charged.   I appreciate them saying this up front - just by clicking you agree to be charged with no farther warning.   However after reading the reviews about Ads I wasn’t willing to take the chance that I might forget to cancel if I hated it. Maybe if the Ad situation gets better I will give it a shot.   I’ll come back in a few weeks and see how the reviews are looking and if the developer is listening to the complaints. It’s one thing to have ads (I have to deal with those on a few apps I have) but it’s another to make them so obnoxious you push people to pay for your app. I want to get a good feel for what the app actually does before paying for it. As it is, I’m listening to the other reviews and going to pass for now until this is fixed.

helpful_reviews.title: Too many ads for premium
helpful_reviews.author: TooFrustratedToTry
helpful_reviews.content: I never got a chance to see if I even like the app because their ads to upgrade pop up about every three seconds and won’t allow you to close them.  In response to the developer, I understand your need for ads, but you need to balance them with the users ability to use your product. I have no intention of upgrading (and deleted the app) because I was not able to try it out and make sure it would work for me. Your app could be amazing, but I’ll never know because you made it too hard to use. I was not exaggerating about the quantity of ads that popped up with no way to move forward without upgrading.

helpful_reviews.title: Giving me the results I’ve wanted
helpful_reviews.author: sarahlp18
helpful_reviews.content: I’ve never wrote a review but wanted to take a second to say it’s worth it to pay $10 a month for the no-ads (since that seems to be what everyone is complaining about).  I’m three weeks in and already down 9 pounds. The app keeps me on track and after a long and hard work makes it easier for me to make healthier choices throughout the day (eating better and drinking less wine).

helpful_reviews.title: My bad... Never trust a lone reviewer
helpful_reviews.author: Mom26andFrustrated
helpful_reviews.content: After paying the $40 upgrade fee and then spending the next 10 minutes trying to get out of the Subscription/You’re already subscribed to this plan/Help loop, I will be cancelling my subscription. Note to the developer: maybe you should invest the money you’re spending on FB advertising and actually produce an app that’ worth something. Shame on you. **Addendum: After cancelling the subscription, it states I will have access to the app for the next 12 months. That would be helpful if the app worked but it doesn’t. I can only assume that the developer is laughing all the way to the bank.  Sir - Be sure to enjoy dinner and a drink on me.

helpful_reviews.title: Forces upgrade or 7 day “free”
helpful_reviews.author: SpitfireJC
helpful_reviews.content: I cannot try this app without also agreeing to a 7 day trial of the premium.  So If I forget to cancel this within 6 Days,  I’ll be billed a YEAR’s  worth up front. No thanks. Horribly high number of ads to the point where you can’t get full info on the app, without being hounded by ads coercing you to join their premium - but the truth is, I never found out what the app would do without premium. That’s how badly handled this app is up front.  Much better free apps exist.  I understand the need for some advertising to aid their business.  But I wouldn’t try anything  out that forces me to pay up front on my credit card.   I tried to skip it or bypass the free trial for the premium, 3 times. It’s so NOT user friendly.   I can’t find out how to ask a question  b/c I’m constantly interrupted by pop up ads demanding I join.   Worst amount of ads on any app I’ve seen.   I am not able to  try it & it’s not worth my time to keep trying. There are more user friendly exercise apps out there.

helpful_reviews.title: Rigid system
helpful_reviews.author: Bicoastalgrrl
helpful_reviews.content: I walk daily and wanted an app to give me some motivation along with step count and other helpful objective measurements.  This app has a well thought out “training” app, but does not allow for flexibility in use.  Day 3? Taking a breather-not that’s I need/want one!  I’m using the app according to me, but the app can not adjust.  If my “assigned workout “ ends while I’m 1/2 mile from my car, there doesn’t seem to be any way to modify the actual activity-you just can’t keep “real” track of what you’ve done.   Needs adjustments-wait on getting this app, unless you fit into their narrow criteria!

helpful_reviews.title: Best App ever!!!!
helpful_reviews.author: EricaP2018
helpful_reviews.content: This is app is so easy to use and you don’t have to keep track of times. Everything is done for you plus you get to pick your music to workout to. The only thing I don’t like about it is that you can’t see you workout days several days in advance and you can’t choose a monthly option instead of entire year. I really think this app is going to help me get healthier =)

helpful_reviews.title: Beware!!
helpful_reviews.author: safk23
helpful_reviews.content: I saw this app online and decided to download it. I didn’t even get to login to setup an account. While going to various other apps a pop up to automatically start the free trial and to automatically renew pops up and because I have the fingerprint on my phone, every time I cleared it out it popped right back open and right when I put my fingerprint to the home button where it took it that I was agreeing to the trial period and auto renew. Seriously?!? At least let me create a login and see what the app is before forcing it on me. Anyway, instead of keeping it I decided to remove it right away. No thanks!

helpful_reviews.title: Auto subscription
helpful_reviews.author: capelady88
helpful_reviews.content: Definitely a very well hidden way to opt out you have to email them then they send you a link so that you can stop the auto subscription. I had canceled the app two months after getting it however I didn’t cancel the auto subscription so I got charged $43 not a very nice surprise. And even though they may say they have a customer service it’s an automated reply when you email with basically the link to the auto subscription. It was very disappointing that there was no human to try to get my money back. I do not recommend this.

helpful_reviews.title: Look!
helpful_reviews.author: blessings poured out 777
helpful_reviews.content: If you are going to offer a free app then it should truly be free. Not only do you offer this app supposedly for free, you also offer this same app under pro. You ask $1.99 one time fee and then slap the user with a yearly subscription fee. Buyer beware—- this app is nothing more than a money grab. Both walking apps are money grabs.  It’s too bad too! There are a lot of people who need help but can’t afford it. Also, there is no true free version of this app. Having the try the premium version on every single page of this app is beyond annoying as well. Very disappointed!

helpful_reviews.title: Music problems
helpful_reviews.author: mchllbrkwtz
helpful_reviews.content: I wish that I could skip a song or change the mix without the music starting all over again. I also don’t understand what the symbols mean in the log (they’re on the left.) Also, I can’t change the mileage on my walk. I use a treadmill and sometimes the app doesn’t have the correct mileage (I put down my phone or something).

helpful_reviews.title: Annoying pop-ups for Premium
helpful_reviews.author: Booboisie4406801
helpful_reviews.content: I was excited to try this app out for walking. I downloaded the app but the Premium pop-ups are extremely annoying and aggressive! When tying to exit out of the ads it still opens them up. It also takes over 3/4 the screen so trying to use the app around the ads is useless.  If you (as a designer) want so badly for someone to pay for a service the  do NOT have it available to download as a free app to “try”.   Unless you want to pay $10 a month for their Premiun service, don’t bother getting this app!

helpful_reviews.title: Too simple to pay for
helpful_reviews.author: Agakabn
helpful_reviews.content: App only tracks your walks. Your Fitbit does the same as does the free app on your phone when you first get it. Also it is hard to listen to music thru the app you follow the guided steps and nothing happens.  Then.... the help steps are hard to find.  Then... to cancel the subscription is a pain... I am sure they just want you to give up and keep paying them for nothing new.  2 stars for tracking your walk and calories but really..... lots of free apps do that already!

helpful_reviews.title: Like it
helpful_reviews.author: CA fighter
helpful_reviews.content: I would like to be able to set the number of days i will walk in a week and also number of times in a day so it fits my schedule better.  I find it discouraging when i miss a session and it puts me behind.  If i want to do it am and pm would like program to recognize it.  Also would be nice to have inside bike option.  I do like it and find it easy to use.

helpful_reviews.title: Worthless app
helpful_reviews.author: islaMexican
helpful_reviews.content: There is not a single thing about this app that is worth paying for.  It doesn’t connect or sync to any devices like a HR monitor, and there are no settings options - it’s nothing but a timer.  It’s no wonder they don’t let you view the app before having to make a decision of the overpriced monthly subscription or the full year which is money in the trash.  Most worthless and overpriced app I’ve ever seen.  Actually costs the same or more than Map my walk which is a fantastic app.  I’ll be going back to map My walk.

helpful_reviews.title: Has potential
helpful_reviews.author: sbsch2003
helpful_reviews.content: I was excited to start using this app after I had to stop exercising due to a running accident.    I started with the trial version and the very first time I used it, it stopped logging my time mid walk and shut down.  The very next time I used it the same thing happened. And, yes, the third time I was almost done with my walk when the app shut down and didn’t log my time.  I’m very disappointed as the app has potential.   I’m trying to figure out how to cancel my trial so I won’t be charged.   It’s not worth it yet.

helpful_reviews.title: Walking baby steps one day at a time
helpful_reviews.author: storygurl

helpful_reviews.title: Why the age restriction?

That then allows anyone to be in the app even when they are younger than 16. I therefore, did not lie about my age.

helpful_reviews.title: This IS the app to start with!!!
helpful_reviews.author: iluvmi4kids
helpful_reviews.content: When I was a kid I could pace out 20 to 25 miles in a day easily, so at 40 I just knew I could get back into shape and start putting some "me" miles back into my daily routine. I started out trying a couple of different apps that had workouts that would go from walking to running to 5k and up, with not much luck and shin splints to add to other health problems. Never was able to get past one or two weeks at a time although I would keep trying and end up physically hurt or disappointed in myself. This app knows what a true beginner is and works you up to the levels you want to achieve in a realistic manageable way. Perfect motivation with upbeat music that makes you want to go that extra 5, 10, 30 minutes enjoying a workout. I can't see anywhere that it tracks those extra minute but, I can jump ahead in the program to a place that is more suitable for minutes I feel I can manage. At 45 my goals are within reach, thanks to this app.

helpful_reviews.title: Super disappointed
helpful_reviews.author: Jayhawknana77
helpful_reviews.content: I was excited to try this app to take my walking to the next level but it is a total letdown for me! I'm a grandma working her way rapidly towards 60 who lives in a small town where the nearest fitness center is 20+ mile away but I have lots of beautiful countryside to walk in. Downloaded the app over the weekend and used it my first day on Monday. Had a little trouble even getting it started as I need my reading glasses for fine print and I don't wear them walking!  Finally got it started thru trial and error. Part way thru the walk an ad popped up and I had to shut the app down and restart it to finish the workout. Didn't track me by GPS but figured it was something I had done. Day 2 was good. Day 3 was a rest day. Today was day 4 and again, the ad popped up but I didn't notice it until I was at a point I knew it should have told me to cool down. Now it tells me I still have 20 minutes left to finish my walk and I know I walked about 2 1/2 miles. I know that if u purchaser the upgrade u can get rid of the ads but I'm not doing that!  I will be deleting the app and looking for a different one. Very disappointing.

helpful_reviews.title: Bunch of crap!
helpful_reviews.author: JoBell34
helpful_reviews.content: Ok so I figured the ads were decreased since all the bad reviews and everyone complaining about them but NO! I downloaded the app about 5 minutes ago and I couldn't even get started let alone read any of the suggestions or hints due to the ads taking up most of the page. Everyone was right when you click on the X it just opens the app instead of closing it and to think this could really be a helpful tool for not just me but many others! Shame on you!!  Ok so since the yearly cost is $40 that is too expensive for a walking app just to remove the ads. I don't usually even write reviews let alone respond back to a comment but I am today. I couldn't even use the app long enough to know if I would want to pay the monthly or yearly fee due to all the ads & then for the X to not remove the ad but to open it instead is just ridiculous! Give the users a chance to see if they will like the apps before flooding them with ads...just a suggestion!!

helpful_reviews.title: Like the app, hate the ads
helpful_reviews.author: MellieD9
helpful_reviews.content: I use the free version of this app.  Love the app because I can listen to my music while walking and it tells me when to warm up, when to walk, when to speed up, and when to cool down. However, the free version has overkill on upgrading to the paid version. $9.99 a month and I HAVE to see at least 2 ads before I can walk.  Still, not horrible. What's horrible is it now starts with a pop up screen for Touch ID for me to buy the $9.99 version without me prompting it.  Seriously? I've accidentally hit it a couple of times, but fortunately have my phone set to require passwords when spending money. It's a useful and helpful app, but they're just too anxious to get money from you.

helpful_reviews.title: Paid for subscription accidentally and now it canâ€™t be turned off!!
helpful_reviews.author: LenkaChan
helpful_reviews.content: Paid for subscription accidentally and now it canâ€™t be turned off!!   I was deleting the app after I lost interest in it and the premium feature subscription popped out as I held the button to get out. I ended up with purchased premium 7day free trial feature with automatic renewal.   I scanned the FQ and went to app settings to turn off automatic renewal. Only there is no such thing. Nothing to turn off. The prime feature is blue but tapping it yields nothing.   So I followed the instructions and went to my settings found the app and looked for turn off automatic renewal. Nothing there but Siri notifications and background refresh.   So in my phone settings I went to iTunes as instructed and looked for it there. Nothing there to turn off.   I say this to demonstrate that Iâ€™m not some confused scared panicked elderly. Iâ€™m fairly literate in technology and I followed the hints from developer. Only I wasted 1h and still my app tells me it will charge my account $9.99+tax monthly until I turn off automatic renewal.   I contacted the developer to see what they are going to do to fix this. Iâ€™m not paying for this even if I have to take it up with Apple iTunes Store.

helpful_reviews.title: Inspiring!!!
helpful_reviews.author: Nadine.53
helpful_reviews.content: I love this app. Makes walking so fun. I look forward to my walks now. I mentioned it to my son who walks as he was looking for a walking app that guides him along the way with voice commands. We both love it. On my days off, I rebound and use the music only, I don't have have to search and download music from iTunes. I just pick a genre, how long I want to rebound and download. Thank you so much. By the way, with my rebounding, and proper nutrition, I have lost 60 pounds, but I then hit a plateau with my rebounding, so I downloaded this walking app to re-jumpstart my weight loss. 5 more pounds down. Did I say that I love this app?

helpful_reviews.title: Absolute trash!
helpful_reviews.author: Lehigh96
helpful_reviews.content: This is one of the worst apps I've ever used.  It is riddled with ads.  There is a constant box below the timer asking you to upgrade to pro version.  Included is a nice little "x" so that you can close the ad right?  WRONG, if you press the "x" it brings you to the screen to upgrade.  Then during my first walk, a trap ad for Walmart shows up telling me I've won a prize and there is no way to close it without closing the entire app!  So I stop my walk to close the app and reopen it.  Once it reopens the ad is gone and a box opens offering me to resume my walk.  I press the YES option, the box disappears and the clock doesn't move.  There is no way to restart the walk so I cut my walk short to write this review and delete this pos from my phone.

helpful_reviews.title: Expensive, bossy and inflexible
helpful_reviews.author: comprende
helpful_reviews.content: To be fair, it is effective and the music is good. Past that, the subscription is too expensive. The seven day free trial only lasted six days so I was tricked into paying for a month.   The app is bossy and inflexible. You can't choose which two days a  week are your rest days. You won't know the length of an upcoming workout until time to do it. When the app decides you're done, that's it. The music ends. Bother you if you feel like continuing or doing some other workout with music (like lifting weights after your walk).  It's not nearly as intuitive and easy to use as the makers believe. The features are nice once you figure them out, but they're all available elsewhere for free. Motivation? Get Zombies, Run! Use IntervalTimer for intervals. Spring has all the same music and more, with bpm, searchable by time, genre, activity and bpm, and Spring will detect your pace and match it with music.  This app is okay and it works, but the early cut-off trial period is a low down dirty trick.

helpful_reviews.title: Audio is off key
helpful_reviews.author: karccrn
helpful_reviews.content: I really like this app a lot but there is room for improvement regarding the audio. Or maybe I am just using it wrong.  First of all, I cannot find s way to go in and listen to the choices for audio without starting. I want to be able to select ahead of time.  Secondly, some genres have the vocals completely off key to the rhythm tracks that they added! I can't listen to those! I am still trying to figure it all out and find it very limited but I love the Latin tracks and they are completely motivating. I don't want to stop when my workout is done!

helpful_reviews.title: App keeps loosing GPS (bug in iOS)
helpful_reviews.author: OJ_L
helpful_reviews.content: This is an updated review after discovering that Apple has introduced a major bug ğŸ�œ in iOS post 10.3.1 and it's still present in 10.3.3 beta and 11.0 developer beta: iPhone 6 is loading GPS and WiFi as well as spotty Bluetooth.  This bug affects this app as well as any app using any of these functions.  So far Apple has yet to acknowledge the bug, as it only affects older phones no longer under warranty.  Users contacting Apple are advised to BUY A NEW PHONE, despite the issue is caused by an iOS update.

helpful_reviews.title: Misleading on ad removal
helpful_reviews.author: Blisslane
helpful_reviews.content: If you purchase to remove the ads you should know that they will still spam you with what they call ad banners. I contacted the customer support and bother response was fast and honest. They did confirm that you will still be spammed with ads. This is misleading.  It is a shame because the app is very good and help you stay motivated whether you're walking inside or outside. However I will not be paying just to still be standby ads and I will be removing this app and reporting them to Apple. Because you cannot state removal of ads and still give someone ads.  Their excuse for it was saying the other apps do this I've never had another app spam me with ads upon as removal.

helpful_reviews.title: Most frustrating app ever!!
helpful_reviews.author: kccjr78
helpful_reviews.content: I can't stand this app. Was recommended by a friend so I tried it. I have NEVER had such a frustrating experience with an app before. I understand that an app with a "Premium" upgrade will want to remind you to consider that from time to time, but their "Upgrade to Premium" screen and/or ad comes up almost every time you click on the screen. I kid you NOT!  The "Upgrade to Premium" pop-ups are so oppressive that it ruined the whole app for me. That's too bad because it may turn out to be a decent app but there are far too many alternative apps that don't bombard you with "Upgrade" pop-ups so I'll move on to one of those. It's a shame.

helpful_reviews.title: Agree w/ review "Bunch of Crap"
helpful_reviews.author: 1Schrammy
helpful_reviews.content: Downloaded app only to find the numerous ads get in the way of even reviewing app. I couldn't even "X" out of ad because it would take me to to the app instead and/or more ads!!!!  It should be AD FREE during the  trial phase to give an opportunity to try it before spending $40 (which is expensive) to purchase it. I will be removing this app since it's so annoying just looking at it....I haven't even used it yet and I can't imagine it would be useful if I'm already frustrated by the inconvenience of the countless ads! This is so unfortunate; I think I probably would of really liked this app and even purchased it.

helpful_reviews.title: It is so motivative
helpful_reviews.author: HessaMaz
helpful_reviews.content: I like the app a lot because I am feeling lazy this time of the year so it am so encouraged and motivated after using walking for weight loss.  I upgraded to the premium version because I want to use all the tools. It is also could be synced to health that would collect all your activity data.  I recommend this application for people who need to be pushed to walk like me ;)

helpful_reviews.title: Great app for beginners to athletes and everyone else
helpful_reviews.author: NuclearWynter
helpful_reviews.content: I love this app. It's easy to use. Gives good explanations of how to choose plans and settings. Offers advice on how to use the program the best way to lose weight. No glitches or weird pausing. Very happy with it. Wish their was a "pay all at once for a year" option for the Premium but otherwise great.

helpful_reviews.title: Requires Membership or Purchase
helpful_reviews.author: Southern467
helpful_reviews.content: I donâ€™t like apps that make you believe they are free to use then require you to either purchase or do a â€œfree trialâ€�. Huge disappointment.  Iâ€™d prefer really basic options and then charge for various upgrade options. Why would I spend money on your app or do a â€œfree trialâ€� if I canâ€™t try it first??  **having the creator of the app respond so quickly to a review is big. I greatly respect the attention they put on their customers comments.

helpful_reviews.title: Helps me focus my time
helpful_reviews.author: Carolinagirl313
helpful_reviews.content: I have been using this app for a week and I like how it does the thinking for me by laying out a doable walking plan. My only suggestion would be to make an option where it uses my location only when the app is open instead of "always or never." I'm constantly turning location services off in my settings so it doesn't  run my battery down.

helpful_reviews.title: The Good and bad
helpful_reviews.author: FightingFatPal
helpful_reviews.content: This app could use some help... This app is helpful for beginners and people who need a little motivation but this app has way too many ads to try to get you to upgrade to pro. Then the other problem with this app is it loses gps often which causes me to stop walking to try to get gps back (which sometimes it's pauses the workout without you knowing) Overall it's an ok app but it does need to be better

helpful_reviews.title: Return it...just return it.
helpful_reviews.author: Semperfi97
helpful_reviews.content: I figured these activity trackers would be a great present for my three children.  I should have listened to my gut and got them real ones but I didn't.  First, it won't sync with the app. So there is no way to change the date or time.  The entire app is ads.  Even if you click the X to close the ad it takes you to page to upgrade.  It's annoying, you can't read anything without ads popping up over what you are trying to read.   These trackers are useless and they will be retired ASAP.

helpful_reviews.title: NO NO NO
helpful_reviews.author: NC Bookworm
helpful_reviews.content: DONT BUY! There is no turn off the automatic renewal. There's nothing inside the app nor in the settings on your phone. As recommended by the developer below, I contacted support today. But when you email support, you really have no way to follow up. In other words, you don't receive a copy of it or anything. How am I to know if it's ever received? It's very frustrating. If this shows up on my credit card, I will obviously be disputing it. I'm only four days in to my seven day free trial and know that I do not want to pay $10 a month for this app.

helpful_reviews.title: Been using it for a few months
helpful_reviews.author: Batbaby1235
helpful_reviews.content: Been using this app for a few months and so far it's been working, it plays music when I want it to and it plays my podcasts when I want when I want it to. I haven't had any glitches or any other problems so far.

helpful_reviews.title: Regardless of the pop-up ads..it does the job!
helpful_reviews.author: Marriednlovinit!
helpful_reviews.content: I really like it a lot! The ads don't bother me one bit because I'm busy working out!..now listen,do nor should I really care what ad shows up as long as the app itself is doing what it's designed to do? Nope! And neither should any of you. Enjoy! Get fit! Be fit!

helpful_reviews.title: But wait....
helpful_reviews.author: Ess.dub
helpful_reviews.content: This app has a lot of potential. I downloaded the free version to give a go before paying, which was my plan - gotta keep people in business. However, the ads on the trial are so invasive and take up 2/3 of the screen that I decided to look elsewhere. Note to whoever gives a rip...those of us who will pay for an app actually need to see something besides a screen full of adds and requests to buy it for, oh I don't know, a couple minutes maybe, while we read your copy. Pffffft. Outta here.

helpful_reviews.title: Disappointing Pop-up Crazy App
helpful_reviews.author: msdu
helpful_reviews.content: This app offers basically nothing in the free version except intermittent prompts from a female voice saying "warm up" , "now walk "...etc. In addition you have to be vigilant to avoid the constant prompts to "Upgrade for one month free trial after which you will be billed $8.99 per month automatically." It pops up every time you make a selection. I couldn't figure out how to add music so it probably isn't an available feature for free. Thoroughly disappointed. Deleting this app from my desktop.

helpful_reviews.title: Easiest App Ever!
helpful_reviews.author: C. Moore
helpful_reviews.content: Used this app with the free 30 day trial for music downloads in the background. Absolutely loved it!  Signed up for a year for a nominal fee and have kept going!  I have gone from a snug size 6 to a comfy size 4 with very little diet change. Super easy to fit into my daily routine and I work 11-13 hour days!

helpful_reviews.title: Strange app behavior
helpful_reviews.author: davidqtn
helpful_reviews.content: This was my first day to use the app.  Very excited; Week 1 Day 1 - 15 minutes total walk time.  When I hit 15 minutes, it announce I was done, only problem - I was still 5 minutes from home.  After 15 minutes, the app stopped measuring and stopped counting my time... I probably walked a quarter mile more than it recorded.  Frustrating...  PS - it’s interesting that the developer’s response below is canned, and doesn’t address the issue I had...

helpful_reviews.title: Like this app
helpful_reviews.author: Lllmomcat
helpful_reviews.content: Been using for 2.5 weeks. Not losing weight yet but can feel my body changing (Fat to muscle?). Like the music, but wish you could select the beats per min easier to match walking speed, or had warmup, walk, & cool down music timed to session & in one mix. Otherwise, like a lot & look forward to my walk every day.

helpful_reviews.title: Needs some work.
helpful_reviews.author: Rsues87
helpful_reviews.content: Love the idea of the app. Some of the reminders are worded rudely. Would like to actually get to try the app and all its features without being hounded every two seconds to try premium. I'm not going to buy something without knowing I like it, but you don't get to use the app with all of the features first. I understand limited features for free version but I mean I don't gat any - can't listen to music, GPS doesn't track...

helpful_reviews.title: All we have to decide is what to do with the time given to us...
helpful_reviews.author: Jacko-Bean
helpful_reviews.content: I don't always have the time to complete my daily workout. The reminder that comes in the early afternoon from this app, gets me thinking of how I can rearrange my schedule to fit it in.

helpful_reviews.title: Ads are too big
helpful_reviews.author: Hauppauge Guy
helpful_reviews.content: Downloaded the free version in order to evaluate it. App looked nice. Clicked on the day 1 information button to read the data. The ad occupied at least 50% of the screen, making it near impossible to read the information and evaluate the app. Pity, the app looks pretty good. The ads are so invasive that I feel like they're the most important part of the experience, not the app itself. Please fix.

helpful_reviews.title: Love this app.
helpful_reviews.author: JewelsLo
helpful_reviews.content: I tried using several apps prior to finding this one. I was a couch potato for years and other apps for beginners where do advanced for coach potatoes. This app got me up moving and keep me motivated at my own pace and helped build up to a faster pace.

helpful_reviews.title: A barrage of requests to upgrade
helpful_reviews.author: PTC-Photograper
helpful_reviews.content: I wanted to try the free version to see what it was all about. In the first 30 secs I had to close about 8 windows asking me if I wanted to upgrade to premium. And when they just continued to pop up I became frustrated.   I don't mine the ads and upgrade requests when I'm using the free version. But when they prevent you from actually using the free app without frustration it's just too much.   I deleted it right away. There are other apps to try.

helpful_reviews.title: Stops going
helpful_reviews.author: Pkchainsaw
helpful_reviews.content: Twice in a 30 minute this app stopped the timer while walking, likely because of all the ads.  After walking 35 minutes there were 6 minutes of workout remaining.  Also, all the ads constantly running in the app caused the battery on my device to drain really quickly, despite being fully charged before leaving. Luckily, I arrived home just before the battery went completely dead.  Terrible app.

helpful_reviews.title: Pretty good
helpful_reviews.author: Real mandorla
helpful_reviews.content: I end up repeating walks and restarting as I'm not always done walking when my exercise is done. I do like how app speeds up and changes music tempo. Wish there was a way to personalize and push myself by using the app while not being limited by the same app. But pretty good app. Don't care for the couch day.

helpful_reviews.title: Who needs it
helpful_reviews.author: Walker92118
helpful_reviews.content: This app was about interval walking to get the maximum benefit out of your walk. I chose the intermediate level. It had me warming up for five minutes, walking for 25, and cooling down for five. Never once did it tell me to walk faster. I seriously doubt that I burned 200.9 calories. I didn't wear a heart rate monitor and I didn't even hold my phone at the time. Who needs a stopwatch to tell you how long to walk?  Just glad I didn't upgrade for 9.99 a month for music.

helpful_reviews.title: Horrible
helpful_reviews.author: tifcoop
helpful_reviews.content: Just downloaded the app because I want to walk in lose the weight. But it keeps asking me do I want to premium account and every time I click on the X to close it out it takes me to the option to buy a premium account. You can't hardly review the information on the free app without them asking you to purchase the premium account. Deleted it after 10 minutes of downloading onto my phone.

helpful_reviews.title: Loaded with Ads!
helpful_reviews.author: PaddyTC
helpful_reviews.content: No  mention of ads in the description; wonder if the Pro version also has ads, but there is no mention there either.  Ads are so intrusive that this probably won't last more than one more try.  Has potential, with links to both Fitbit and Runkeeper.  Also can post to Facebook (if you are the type who wants to do that!)

helpful_reviews.title: Awful!
helpful_reviews.author: Babygyrrl04
helpful_reviews.content: Wow! I downloaded this to try it and sure enough...like other folks have reported...the pop ups to upgrade to premium absolutely inundate you!! How are you suppose to focus on your goal if you're spending all your time trying to close advertisements to get you to buy the premium product?!? I don't need to spend $120 a year to walk! I'll be deleting this after about 5 minutes of having it downloaded!

helpful_reviews.title: Walking for Life
helpful_reviews.author: MommaHau
helpful_reviews.content: This app is fantastic! It would be even better if we could extend it after the workout. I would also love to be able to access the music outside of the work out I love the music!

helpful_reviews.title: Keeps me motivated
helpful_reviews.author: Education diva
helpful_reviews.content: I have decided to live a healthier lifestyle and this app motivates me to keep moving. It tells you how long each section of the session is so you can move. I enjoy using it. I listen to my own music though.

helpful_reviews.title: Lisa
helpful_reviews.author: 2Blisakay
helpful_reviews.content: I have been using this App for about 1 month! I was at a Crossfit gym and relocated. I needed something to take the place of that. This app hasn't disappointed. I love the interval training, and reminders that it sends through notifications!

helpful_reviews.title: Great!
helpful_reviews.author: Briansmybaby09
helpful_reviews.content: This app totally keeps me motivated!  I started on the beginning level as I had been sedentary. I am at the end of beginner level and excited to move up to intermediate!  Along with diet changes I have lost 25lbs and improved my stamina!

helpful_reviews.title: Love the walking app
helpful_reviews.author: 5ar4.6
helpful_reviews.content: This is great for people wanting to ease into exercising regularly. I was a runner until I injured my foot a year or so ago. After healing it hurt to run still, so I downloaded the walking app to help build up to running and it's been great!

helpful_reviews.title: DON'T waste your time!!
helpful_reviews.author: jrg84
helpful_reviews.content: What a POS app!  All it does is flash the 'buy the premium' at each and every turn.  I figured it was a rudimentary program to get you hooked so you would want to buy the premium app. But the free version doesn't even provide any value so you can make an informed decision about the premium version.  Now that I have wasted 6 minutes of my life on this POS, perhaps you will only spend 20 seconds to read this and avoid this app!

helpful_reviews.title: Love this App!
helpful_reviews.author: Tdtx1
helpful_reviews.content: It has worked perfectly and I have been using for almost 7 weeks. The music is great and makes the exercise much easier for a non-exerciser like me.  Definitely recommend!!

helpful_reviews.title: Horrible
helpful_reviews.author: usaforf16
helpful_reviews.content: I wanted to give it a try before purchasing the "premium". Extremely frustrating that you cannot do that because you cannot get past the continuous pop-ups for the premium upgrade.   I would suggest that the app only be offered for a price rather than waste time and frustrate those that would just like to try the free app first.  I'll move onto a different app- one that is honest from the start.

helpful_reviews.title: Great app to get you off the couch
helpful_reviews.author: Bang bang shrimp
helpful_reviews.content: I think this is a great app to help ease into exercising on a regular basis. It's motivating because you only need to take 15 min out of your day to do it. The only issue is there is no way to manage the rate or speed for warm up and the time spent actually walking.

helpful_reviews.title: DO NOT DOWNLOAD
helpful_reviews.author: Dad's PC
helpful_reviews.content: I downloaded this thinking I would like it.  When I opened it, I was literally harassed with pop ups to upgrade to the premium on every screen I went to, to the point I became disgusted and just deleted it.  I could not even get a feel for what the app was like because of the pop ups!!! I like to try before I buy.  After reading the reviews, I'm glad I didn't fall for the "free" (not free) 7 day trial.  Wish I could give 0 stars!

helpful_reviews.title: I'm finishing Week 5!
helpful_reviews.author: Rosee3019
helpful_reviews.content: I love the app! I'm hoping to get back into running but wanted to start off walking first. They are short workouts every day that I can do during my babies nap times. I'm still using the free app.

helpful_reviews.title: Walking
helpful_reviews.author: ErinKP1313
helpful_reviews.content: Still working on trying it out haven't figured out how to use all the options. Would be more fun if I could only I could play my own music music while I'm walking also. So it's a work in progress and I'll let you know how goes thanks

helpful_reviews.title: Great app but obnoxious music
helpful_reviews.author: Barbara Vorpe
helpful_reviews.content: The program itself seems fine, but the music I bought with the Premium Subscription is obnoxious and I can't seem to change it. If I can't change it, I will be cancelling the premium upgrade. Even with the premium upgrade, there seems to be a lot of ads.

helpful_reviews.title: Love this app
helpful_reviews.author: Lindy1400
helpful_reviews.content: This app helped me lose 16 pounds the first round through. I've begun all over again and alternating between the app program and weight training to help with toning and strength as well as weight loss. I'm very happy with it.

helpful_reviews.title: Gotta pay up
helpful_reviews.author: Tigerbob06
helpful_reviews.content: It says try for free, and the first thing it does is try to hook you into automatic payment after 7 days with the onus on you to cancel if you decide you don't like it. Here's an idea - let me see if I like it first, and then let me set up payment if I do. Real shame - was looking forward to trying this, but I hate hate hate the money first approach. If the app is good enough, I'd have paid. As it is, uninstalling.

helpful_reviews.title: Great App!
helpful_reviews.author: Jessopalis
helpful_reviews.content: So far this has been a great motivator.  I've been able to push myself to a higher level of activity and then push some more with the help of this app.

helpful_reviews.title: Respectable
helpful_reviews.author: STFlow
helpful_reviews.content: Good app. Appreciate the logs, maps. Nice that it reduces the music volume to talk to you. One peeve: Stops recording at planned time limit. One is never home at that point in the walk, so your log is "short", map doesn't show you finishing at starting point.

helpful_reviews.title: Love it!
helpful_reviews.author: EffieGreenOz
helpful_reviews.content: I've only been using it for a short time but I already look forward to walking! The music mix makes all the difference for me.

helpful_reviews.title: Love this Apo
helpful_reviews.author: jdfoster53
helpful_reviews.content: This is a great app for me.  Only thing I wish it could do was have a customized button for shorter work out on days I work.   I walk early in morning before I go to work.

helpful_reviews.title: I like it a lot
helpful_reviews.author: JoeyFire
helpful_reviews.content: They have done a good and inspiring job on putting this app together.  The way they put the songs to roll in to the next without loosing the "Four on the Floor" beat is really good.

helpful_reviews.title: It’s not easy to use this
helpful_reviews.author: Crabapple44
helpful_reviews.content: It took trial and error to get this working right while on my treadmill. Paid the 9.99, and it worked. Learned to lock the screen, but can’t turn off the music. Had to walk outside, and for some reason, it needed to keep restarting, and lost all of the work that I had done. Makes me sad.

helpful_reviews.title: Love app but crashes every walk
helpful_reviews.author: Ga2peach
helpful_reviews.content: Love the app and use it daily but never fails that the App closes at least 2 times when walking - drives me crazy. App is up to date so need update done to fix this please

helpful_reviews.title: Motivating app!
helpful_reviews.author: Wkmgtor
helpful_reviews.content: Saw an advertisement for this app on Facebook was hesitant at first but this app is like having a personal trainer to coach me up and it's helping me increase my endurance each and every day.  I love it so far!

helpful_reviews.title: Just started using
helpful_reviews.author: Peru101
helpful_reviews.content: I just started using this app and so far I am pleased. There are three walking levels beginners, intermediate, and advanced. You can also listen to music and your workouts are recorded.

helpful_reviews.title: Still learning
helpful_reviews.author: Applepiesue
helpful_reviews.content: I've used this app for a week. It helps keep me motivated. I like the music mixes too and the way it speeds up and down. Good workout for the not super fit people who want somewhere to start.

helpful_reviews.title: It's expensive
helpful_reviews.author: Verushkita
helpful_reviews.content: I downloaded the free app. It didn't allow me to use it because the offer to upgrade to premium was constantly stopping me from getting to use the "free" app. If they placed a price in the App Store, we'd know whether we want to pay for it, or not. But placing it as a free app then not letting you use it unless you pay for it... it is misleading in my world.   I deleted it!

helpful_reviews.title: Great App
helpful_reviews.author: Needs Improvemen
helpful_reviews.content: This is a great app, but I wish it wasn't so infiltrated with ads.  I understand there is a paid version of this, but the free version makes it undesirable at times.  I also wish on non-walk days there was the ability to add what was done as the replacement.

helpful_reviews.title: Complete waste of iPhone space
helpful_reviews.author: Munnkey2
helpful_reviews.content: I walk daily and was hoping for an app that would take it up a notch. This app did nothing for me. Everything on the app was about ads trying to get me to buy Premium. I would try to close the ads and another would pop up. I just wanted to try your app to see if the money was worth it! And it's not.

helpful_reviews.title: I like it.
helpful_reviews.author: Brintho2
helpful_reviews.content: I've been looking for an app that motivates me to work out and with the rewards and achievements in each app I am will to work out without fuss.

helpful_reviews.title: It keeps me Moving!
helpful_reviews.author: brown shoe
helpful_reviews.content: Love this app! I refer to it all the time ! I check my steps daily always wanting to increase my daily average steps or mileage! It keeps me moving!

helpful_reviews.title: Love it
helpful_reviews.author: Buddysaunt
helpful_reviews.content: I would give it 5 stars if you the workout didn't just stop after the time. The running app keeps tracking in case you are not totally done

helpful_reviews.title: Useless for real life
helpful_reviews.author: Sangoma63
helpful_reviews.content: Unless you follow each step to the second its pretty pointless. Endure long warmups for brief walks, and if your walk takes longer than the allocated minutes the extra is ignored. Dont dare walk more than once a day either, the app knows a lot about you but apparently not the date today. All this for free if you survived the barrage of ads...
